review_content: 0,5l can. A hazy pale beer with a very rich and soft white head. Very strong aroma. It is dominated by citrus and it has also notes of orange, mandarin and coriander. Flavor is sour and sweet with notes of citrus, lemon, orange, peach and minerals. Finish is fruity and floral.
Poured from the tap. Hazy yellow with small white head. Lemon, orange, grapefruit. Tick.

330ml blue colored bottle from Lidl if i'm not mistaken drinking it on 22/08/2021 BB 07.07.22 Pours a slightly hazy mostly clear pale yellow with a thin layer of small bubbly foam on top and good lacing. Very fruited and aromatic aroma with notes of citrus, orange, wheat, spices and flowers. Taste is fresh, light and easy, maybe even too much but with a pleasant fruited soft flavour of fruits, (orange, lemon, apricot peach) wheat, orange peel, coriander and some flower like note. Very easy to drink and inoffensive, not really any bitter. Quite different and surprising taste at first, but well made and enjoyable i would say. Light body and smooth oily texture, soft carbonation. Really ok for what it is but a bit too light, guess it can be really nice if you're in the right mood for something easy.
Hazy light golden beer with a big fluffy head (as expected from a Belgian White). Taste was also as expected except for a light orange and a bit stronger peach taste
On tap @ Alkan Rantacafe. Hazy. Typical belgian white with citrus and floral & soapy notes. Fresh and light, good at terrace. No bitterness at all.
Can from Odessa . Aroma like orange juice white head taste little fruity and sweet but in good way this beer is really good.

Hazy golden with a thick and heavy foam.

Citrus and floral notes with some acidity withouth being sour.
Bottle, 5.0%. Cloudy yellow colour. Very big stable white head. Citric and lemony aroma, but not acidic or sour as such. The flavour is mildly lemony with a good lemon peel.

Draught at Puben Uppsala. Pleasant, relaxed white ale. Smooth, not that prominent banana and coriander features as is usually encountered in this style, more "laid back". Went well with a chicken tikka dish.
On tap at Bishops Arms Sundbyberg. Hazy yellow with a white head. Kind of artificial with bubble gum, perfume, light citrus and hints of apricot. Thin and boring.

Found out of bottle from Whiplash Music Bar in Tarnow, Poland. Pours a light white-yellow with medium heavy white foam. Taste was really lacking any significant notes for the style. Below average for me.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy  yellow with a white head. Aroma and flavour are lemons, coriander, and wheat - with an ever so slightly dry finish.
Very powerful peach taste and smell. This is quite a unique beer and really worth a try. Other notes include banana and bread. Interesting blue bottle with the 1664 number embedded in the glass.

Hints og Cirtus and beary notes
Aftertaste good snd sweet 
Good for hot summers day

Fine lasting foam and an aroma of wheat and citrus. The taste has a bit of the wheat beer's classic banana taste and also you can taste citrus, a little coriander, bitter orange peel and a slightly entangled spicy taste which is difficult to define. It has light fullness and good thirst-quenching properties, but if you are a definite fan of Witbier and wheat beer in general, there are definitely many better beers on the market. Towards the end, it has a little malt sweetness and it is an excellent wheat beer that can be suitable here in the spring sun.
Draught at bar. Hazy yellow color, white head. Bittersweet taste with citrus, wheat, banana, lime and malts. Bittersweet finish with citrus, wheat, malts, lime and grass. Okay wheat beer.
Bottle. Hazy blond with a frothy white head. Aroma of sweet banana nectar and passion fruit body lotion. Sweet banana candy taste with a hint of lemon, light body and sweet banana finish.

Cloudy wheat beer, with notes of citrus and very faint mango. Not much hop in the taste. Very inoffensive and easy to drink. No bitterness at all. This is a warm summers day beer. Not bad, but also very forgettable.

Old rating from 2013 - 500ml bottle, pours a hazy straw colour with a good size foamy white head. Aromas & tastes of banana, orange peel, lemon, citrus, coriander, grain, hints of spice & yeast. Moderate body. Sweet light bitter finish. Highly enjoyable

Shaker pint draft at the French Market restaurant in Prairie Village, Kansas. The pour is a hazed orange golden with a foamy white head that falls with a sheet of lace. The aroma is orange fruit citrus, some grass and herbal yeast. The taste is orange, sorta artificial sweetness and finishing with an herbal yeast. The palate is unfiltered medium bodied with soft carbonation and orange fruit in the aftertaste. Decent Wit.
Gilden ,hazy with a medium white head. A fruity aroma with some citrus and spices sense. Medium bitter with a fruit ending.

0.5 Can from local store, brewed by Carlsberg Serbia.

Pours juicy dark lemonade color, with medium short lasting head. Nice juicy smell. Juicy taste with notable caramel flavor with a kind of cheap unpleasant finish. Pretty sweet with orange notes, low on coriander. Contains glucose syrup. Fine taste of beer, well on carbonation, but too much sweet for my taste. Nice for the summer on a beach.

Pivo nije loše al nije ni sjajno, jake arome i vrlo slatko, podseća me na energetski napitak sa ukusom. Ukus piva podjednako prisutan sa aromama i fina je kombinacija ukusa. Završnica razočaravajuća, ali sve u svemu, zadovoljan sam.

Zapach przyjemny. mdłe pszeniczne nuty są przysłonięte, słodką, soczystą pomarańczą. Złote, półprzejrzyste, ładna pianka. Łagodne, lekko słodkawe, lekko owocowe pomarańcza, nuty pszeniczne lekkie i delikatne, pustawe i nieco nijakie, pijalne całkiem bo nie za słodkie, nawet nawet ale bez żadnej rewelacji, nic ciekawego.
Can. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus and grass. Flavor of lemon, wheat, grain, fruit and light spices.

Medium, averagely balanced nuances of fresh wheat and citrus, some minerals. Somewhat artificial. Light hops with unclear profile. Narrow taste spectrum and short aftertaste with light wheat. Light body with medium carbonation. Overall, clear but simple. 5 3 4 2 9
Nordic Pizza Companyssa 11/2020. Easy, pleasant wheat, lacks character in some way.

En ret kedelig øl, hvis jeg skal være ærlig. Den smager en anelse af citrus, som alligevel ikke kendetegner Witbier. Flasken er ikonisk blå og ret pæn, og den hælder let og gul hazy væske. Hovedet er udemærket hvid. Den er let at drikke, og har en let-medium carbonation.
Tap. Hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, yeast, spices and fruit. Flavour is malt, wheat, yeast, spices, medium sweet, hop, fruit and a little bitter.

Tap @ Lamaens 50 year reception. Appearance: pours hazy golden with good creamy white head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, bread, wheat, oranges, light spices, fruity notes, grass and floral notes. palette: medium malty and yeasty aroma, average carbonation, medium body, medium to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a light to medium bitterness, average duration, sweet finish and a watery texture. Overall: enjoyably wit
Draft pours hazy golden with a white head.  Aroma of wheat, spice and some grass.  Taste is pretty basic just some grains and a hint of spice.
Hazy pale color with white head. Aroma of lemon and wheat, a bit perfume like. Taste is light sweet, lemon and fruity notes and perfume like finish. Refreshing beer.
Tap and Can. Pours hazy pale yellow with a white head. Cornish and wheaty nose and flavor with a touch of lemon slash dishwasher. Thin and flabby finish.
Bottle. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Wheat, citrus, fruity, peel. Nice and refreshing.

Sweet citrus aroma. Impressive white head. Bright orange colour.
Refreshing lemon flavor.
Decent white beer, but if you take a look at the ingredients... It's not so cool. A lot of unnecessary stuff like aroma, syrup etc

Sample from bottle. Fruity citrus flavor is notable but not overly dominant. A bit artificial, but not overly so, very fruity, floral, sweet orange, grapefruit, not bitter, crisp, sweet but not too much. Could be worse.

Pours a hazy dark yellow with white head, strong citric aroma, taste sweet with a sour finish, medium bodied. Gives a sort of artificial feel, although between this and a bunch of eurolager piss there's little contest.

0.5l can
Refreshing, lots of citrus (even more than Hoegaarden). Best served ice cold in a hot summerday.
Didn't have an A/B comparison with Hoegaarden but seems to be similar. However, much more expensive than Hoegaarden with only 250 ml bottle!

Enjoyed: Poured from bottle into weizen glass.   
Appearance: Blurry pale yellow colour, rich head which soon fades.
Aroma: Citrus, candy, wheat, dusty.
Palate: Medium body, light carbonation.
Taste: Wheat, grains, citrus aftertaste.
Overall impression: Bottled into cool blue bottle which looks refreshing – and it is...it’s easy and drinkable.

500 ml can at the Winking Lizard in Copley Ohio.  Smell sweet wheat.  Cloudy, light yellow with thin white head that hangs on the glass. Light and fluffy. Little bit of lemon and sweetness in the aftertaste. This beer was a nice surprise and I really like! Cheers!

33cl bottle poured into a brandy snifter. The beer is a hazy yellow with a white head of foam. The aroma has grassy notes with a bit of an herbal, lemony side. Fairly perfumy and sweet. Medium body and moderate carbonation.
Halmgul grumlig vätska med vitt skum, som avklingar snabbt. Doftar svagt av persika och en aning örter. Torr smak där persika definitivt återfinns.

Налилось свойственно для бельгийской пшенички. Мутный, желтый. Пенка небольшая. По ароматике цитрусы. Гвоздички не чувствуется. Вкус пустоват. Ощущаются цитрусы, но быстро смываются. Итог: в рамках стиля, но слишком простовато и как-то разбодяжено.
Hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is wheat, flowers and herbs. Taste is light sweet

Nice beer i like it yes 
Very nice taste haha yes very good heheh niice funny
Tasted this beer. Drinkable to Pink Floyd, Elbow and other great bands. Remember to enjoy your beer in company with good friends.
Cloudy, citrusy and, ultimately, a little bit chemically on the aftertaste.

This is a fresh and sweet beer, first of all it has a small head, and a low to medium body, alcohol is not noticeable, and there is a clear citric flavor mixed with some caramel sweetness, the aroma is also sweet and citric. About the appereance is a pale and hazy beer with fast rising bubbles
Very smooth toasty wheat beer with a smooth fruity undertone not harsh at all and definitely kicks blue moon to the curb in my opinion.

But en fût à la Chasse Gallerie de l’UQTR. Il s’agit d’une bière très pâle avec un mousse plutôt éphémère. Au nez, on ne remarque pas d’odeur particulière. Les saveurs sont très subtile. On y retrouve des arômes de pêches principalement ainsi qu’un soupçon de d’agrume. J’apprécie cette bière car elle est peu complexe mais savoureuse malgré tout. Lorsque je suis contraint de choisir entre plusieurs bières commerciales, la Kronenbourg 1664 Blanche figure parmi mes premiers choix.

Linella market 17,5lei - 0,46l
Aromă fructată, artificială. Gust de coriandru, pîine, lămîie.

Fruity aroma.
Refreshing and drinkable.
A little bit of sourness and citrus in taste.
Watery mouthfeel.
W aromacie kolendra, trawa cytrynowa, typowo witbierowy, przyjemny. Barwa ciemnozłota, piana ładna. W smaku półwytrawne, kolendra, cytryna. Fajny klasyczny witbier.

Barwa jasnożółta, mętne, piana biała, dość obfita, dość trwała. W aromacie cytrus, nieco kolendry. W smaku wytrawne, nieco zbożowe, trochę skórki pomarańczy, niewiele kolendry. Wysycenie w normie, trochę za mało się dzieje. Ujdzie, ale bez szału.

0.5 can bought at Maxi supermarket, Nis. Hazy yellow colour with thin white head.  Aroma: lemony, acidic , spicy, citrus peel, taste is following the aromas but it gas pretty odd, artificial add to it . Medium bodied.

Got 5 beers plus a cool looking glass for a decent price. Sweet taste , a bit of lemon , a bit of coriander and a bit medicinal flavor. Not great but not bad , better than some other beers from Carlsberg.

This beer has caramel coloring in it, which is not the best thing in any style but makes zero sense in a wit. It tastes like Blue Moon mixed about 70:30 with orange soda with a dash of lavender essential oils. I guess it is not all that bad for what it is... Which is stupid.
as i dont drink very often, is perfect for those moments. i absolutely love this beer. for me, is best beer ever.

Bottled. Hazy yellow colour, small white head, fair durablity. Fruity aromas of lemon, wheat, coriander. Taste of bread, coriander, lemonade, no hops. Light body, high carbonation, watery texture, sweetish yeasty finish. Not really a good one, but ok.

Sweet aroma, like an orange, a bit weaker. Very murky beer, nice decent foamy whitehead. 
Tastes very very sweet nice taste to it, reminds me of peaches. Pleasent mouthfeel. For the price and for an industrial beer it's a very pleasant and nice beer.
50cl can poured into glass.
Słodkie, na pierwszym planie pomarańcza, barwa pomarańczowa. Piana średnia, po sekundzie opada do zera. W składzie syropy
Jóillatú jóillatú karakteres ízű szerintem pedig a narancsos ízű nagyon kulturált ez egy kicsit ilyen Fancy sörre vált

I get this beer by accidentally.. I was looking for the "Lager" over this but in the end i feel lucky to taste this beer.. 
First of all if you see the ratings is not so bad here and specially in the advocate.. And that is encouraging for some beer you get by accidentally.. Anyway this beer remind me a lot the "Hoegaarden" original and that is amazing feeling.. The taste is very fruity with some little sour notes.. You feel some lemon, grapefruit and apricot here.. All these fruits is my cup of tea and make this beer great..
Overall one very refreshing and light beer to drink with a lot fruits inside.. What other you can ask? For the style is amazing beer and deserving much more better ratings in my opinion.. Also when you can get this beer only 50 euro cent coin..

Bottle, 0.33l. Aroma of citrus, wheat, coriander and biscuit. Pours hazy pale golden color with medium sized soapy white head and sparkling appearance. Taste starts medium sweet grainy and papery, following is mild citrusy, faint spicy, grassy and medicinal, mouthfeel is smooth, while finish is mild bitter. Light body, creamy texture and average carbonation in palate. Artificial aroma, while taste is not much existing...
It’s like a fruit punch in a bottle of beer . Didn’t expect that ! Not only citrus like the label says ... it’s melon , peach and maybe more

Draft at Clark's Oyster Bar. Yellow appearance with slight haze and a white head. Aroma of wheat/grains, mild citrus zest and a light herbal spice. Similar flavor, grainy and fruity with mild sweetness and light bitterness. Light body with a slight watery feel and an easy finish. OK.
Hazy yellow color, big white head. Fruity and floral aroma. Sweet lightly sour taste. Refreshing beer.

Bottle. Hazy yellow with white head. The aroma has notes of artificial fruit juice, melon sherbet, orange and detergent. The flavor is sweet with notes of melon, sherbet, artificial, wheat, orange. Medium-bodied.

Blonde, hazy color, weak white head. 
Fruity, fresh aroma.
Taste is fruity, sweet, and refreshing. Very mild, almost like a soft drink. Good, medium body and mothfeel, medium carbonation, almost zero bitterness. 
Easy drinking beer. Too expensive for what it offers.
Golden with white head. Aroma sweet with some wheat notes. Taste a bit too sweet.

25.05.20 Aromat owocowy i słodowy z owoców jakby truskawki, wydaje się trochę sztuczny.
Mętne o kolorze żółto pomarańczowym z dużą pianą
W smaku dominują słody, jednak właściwie to nie czuć za wiele trochę wytrawne, lekka goryczka pomarańczowa
Nagazowanie duże, wytrawne puste, goryczka cytrusowa na finiszu, lekkie,
Ogólnie w tym piwie nic się nie dzieje tak pustka jakby był bez alkoholowy

Bottle at Carnivore, Kaş.
Pours hazy gold with white head. Wheaty, peachy nose. Tastes bit peachy, easy drinking.

Pours hazy yellow with a thick white head. Aroma of fresh orange and wheat elements. Taste has huge citrus elements, soft grapefruit, heavy orange hints. Palate has slight hints of coriander. Fantastic.

On tap at Kvart, Trešnjevka, Zagreb. Thanks, Leon. Hazy pale golden, small creamy white head. Aroma is fake sugary fruit cake, floral, candy or chewing gum and perfumy. Sweetened malty flavour, generally sweet, floral and perfumy. Light body, moderate carbonation, light finish. Drinkable by forgettable.

Really mild, fruity flavor, lightly scented.  Pours a thick head, cloudy yellow brew.  Finish is quite dry to me; easy to drink, not heavy like many beers are for me.  Found it on sale in 16 oz cans and went back and bought a case.   I am not big on beers but I like this one.
Uzupełnienie ocen piwnych bez opisu z uwagi na przeniesienie z papierowych zapisków.

Kronenbourg 1664 Blanc is a modern, fruity and refreshing wheat beer.
Never been much for wheat beers, but this one was very enjoyable.

Can 0,50L. Hazy yellow color with big, creamy, white head.  Aroma of wheat, peach, orange and bread. Taste is light sweet with notes of peach and gentle touch of coriander. Quite juicy mouthfeel. Light to medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation. Drinkable and refreshing during hot summer days.
Notas de brioche, naranja y melocotón. Intensidad media en nariz. Equilibrada con predominio del dulce y final ligeramente astringente. Buena bebestibilidad. Para repetir.
Smell of lemon, coriander. Cloudy lemon colour, high white head. Aroma of malt, coriander, yeast, lemon. Medium sweet. Stinging. Lively carbon.
Po wyglądzie dałbym się oszukać, że to prawdziwy witbier, ale już w aromacie i smaku nie da się pomylić. Syrop glukozowy, syrop karmelowy i aromat - tyle w temacie.

Fruity wheat aroma. Hazy golden/yellow color, medium-sized, good looking, durable foam. Tastes like peach compote, but in a beer version. Coriander and wheat taste. Pleasant drink, enjoyable speciality.
Bottle, big bubbly head with some lacing, cloudy palish orange color, yeast, cooked apples and some citrus behind. Bad.
Herbal, floral and lots of coriander seed and clove sitting just behind the banana flavour. Hazy straw, creamy head.
Hazy yellow color with off-white head. Aroma has citrus, yeast, wheat and some spices. Taste is malty sweet with somewhat sweet aftertaste. Flavors of citrus, wheat malt, yeast and banana.
33 cl. Kobolt-blå flaske. 5.0. %. En dejlig Weis beer. Dejlig drikkelig og frisk og tørstslukkende

Barwa jasnożółta, mętne. Obfita czapa piany, oblepiającej szkło. Bardzo dobrze wygląda.
W aromacie dziwne, mało witbierowe, ale nawet przyjemne. Na początku uniósł się zapach niemieckiego, metaliczno-ziołowego pilsa, potem pomarańcza, mandarynka, nadal wyraźny metal, lekka kolendra.
Smak już nieco bardziej w stylu. Owocowe (znów pomarańcza), kwiatowe, kolendra bardziej intensywna, niż w aromacie. Nie czuć słodu, goryczka bardzo niska. Na szczęście nie jest wodniste, za to bardzo pijalne i fajnie orzeźwiające.
Patrząc na większość recenzji, spodziewałem się czegoś gorszego, ale nie jest źle.
Bottle. Skunky (blue bottle ?), apples skin, moldy and spicy aromas. Sweetish, spicy, citric, grassy, apples, stale, hay flavors. Light-bodied, fizzy. So-so.
Bottle sample at a tasting at Max's place. Thanks Stas. Hazy pale yellow. Coriander, citrus, graininess, sweetish, a bit candy-ish.

Lightweight white beer with a slightly malty flavor. Pleasant beer aroma. Notes of coriander and citrus. Light head, low intensity mouthfeel...not overly fizzy, but carbonation still noticeable. Very enjoyable beer for summer.
If you are the type that doesn't like the taste of coriander/cilantro, this beer tastes has a citrusy Hoegaarden that has a soapy aftertaste.

największy efekt robi kolor butelki , piwo mętne, piana szybko znika w smaku goryczkowo-cytrusowe posmaki z delikatną nutą kolendry co nadaje charakteru  piwu i bardzo dobrze się komponuje,  jak na kocnerniak naprawdę dobry napitek  .
Malty-sweet honey-ish flavor with light bready  notes~ Zesty, orange-citrusy fruitiness~ Light note of coriander~ Refreshing & that's it.
From 2nd Tel Aviv tasting. A light yeasty wit with some nice soft notes. Easy drinking.
At Max Place, pours yellow hazy with a nice head, aroma of orange peel, lemon, guava, peach, apricot, flavor of apricot, peach, medium bodied

Citrus blossoms (lemon tree) and some white pastry on the nose
Light mouthfeel, mild carbonation and watered out lemonade . Hints out lemon peel and perfumed marmalade.

Quite good, though hard to find the feel of “beer”
Barwa zolta zmetniona. Piana obfita drobne pecherze. Aromat kolendra pomarancza. Smak slodki owoce pszenica. Goryczka niska wysycenie ok.
Aroma is very fruity, grapefruit, citrus zest smelling. Very empty in taste, feels a bit like butter.
Hazy yellow color, medium white head. Aroma lemon, grass, peach. Taste lemon zest, spices, light body. Quite pleasant surprise, very refreshing
Bought theme of mistake (thought i bought the original 1664) in France on vacation. Should been really cooled down before drinking, typical summer beer.
Boca 0,33L - kupljena u ROTOu - znači pivo koje mirisom i aromom strašno podsjeća na sok od breskve..

2016 03 12
Butelka 0,33 l. Piana bardzo obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa i trwał, zostawia ładne smugi i wytrzymuje do końca. Kolor piwa jest słomkowy, wpadający w jasnozłoty, trunek mocno zamglony. Aromat jest intensywny, ale daje wrażenie całkowitej sztuczności, co potwierdza etykieta, wymieniająca dodatek aromatu. Wyczuwalna sztuczna multiwitamina, guma balonowa i trochę kolendry. W smaku jest podobnie, dominuje sztuczna cytrusowość z nutą kolendry, poza tym piwo jest kwaskowe i dość wytrawne. Goryczki brak. Pełnia jest niska, mała treściwość i wodnistość w upale pewnie byłaby zaletą, bo wraz z wysokim wysyceniem i cytrusowością nieźle orzeźwia, ale pod koniec zimy dobrego wrażenia nie robi. Dość pijalny, ale bardzo przeciętny i sztuczny witbier, może w tej kategorii konkurować z Białym z Żywca.

Hmmm I didn't have any expectations from this beer, but I must say after its cooled and poured nicely into the glass, I was really surprised. Maybe due to hot weather but beer felt really nice, nice wheat flavor plus some citrus on the side. I like it. My new favorite summer wheat beer :)

Florya migrosta bulunuyor. Şunu belirtmeliyim şişesi mükemmel. Güzel ve kısmen uzun süren bir köpüğe sahip, kokusu neredeyse bir meyve suyunu andırıyor. Maalesef hiç berrak bir görünüme sahip değil. İçimi hafif fakat alışılmışın dışında bir tada sahip, şişenin yarısına doğru damak alışıyor ve tadı giderek daha hoş bir hale gelmeye başlıyor.

Mętne w kolorze cytryny (w szafirowej butelce robi niezły efekt) piana o wzorcowej strukturze. 
W aromacie, jak to u wita, cytrusy i kolendra. Delikatna marihuana? 
W smaku nie za ciekawie. Słodko, mdło. Słaby cytrus, niska goryczka. Duży gaz i ślady pomarańczy.
Słabo
Very hazy pale golden with a small foamy white head. Aroma: Cirtus candy, straw and wheat. Taste. Sweet and sour, tastes much like bubblegum. Not at all unpleasant but artificial tasting

No tiene tanta espuma pero el sabor citrico la hace caracteristica, una cosa es que te tomes una cerveza y te sepa buena, pero esta te puedes tomar varias y no te hostiga, es de mis cervezas preferidas.
Had from bottle.  Aroma was pleasant enough, citrusy and wheat.  But the taste was too fruity, like artificial flavoring - more like a bad soda than a beer.  Unenjoyable.
Light crisp citrus wheat beer , easy drinking , doesn't leave any after taste

Słomkowej barwy, zamglone.
Piana drobna, biała, dosyć trwała.
Aromat rześki, owocowy, kwiatowy.
W smaku trochę wodniste, wydaje się słodzone, kwaśność niska.
Fruity and so sweet. There are so many different beers in same price range that million times better than this. Weird taste. But I must confess, bottle looks so good.

Narandzaste boje, mutno, tanka bijela pjena, skoro da ne postoji. Citrusno-voćne arome (breskva i narandza), blago karamel. Slatko, gorčina tek u naznakama. Kratak sladak finiš. Vodeno-uljane teksture, srednje karbonizacije.

0,5 l can. Pours completely hazy light yellow with big, dense, medium lasting white head. Aroma is mainly spices, coriander and citrus. Hardly a hint of wheat malt beneath it. Taste is medium sweet with some mild bitterness. Flavor follows aroma. Body is light, texture slick and carbonation lively, almost prickly. Finish is short and unremarkable, a bit of coriander and that's about it. Both aroma and flavor of citruses are weird, sweet and artificial. Nevertheless, beer is drinkable if not a great specimen of it's kind.
Prvo sam mislio da je jako loše, ne znam zašto. I iznenadio sam se, pivo je odlično! Kremaste teksture, blijedo zlatne boje i bogate pjene. Okus odličan, nemam sto prigovoriti.
Hazy pale yellow color, creamy white head. Citrus, malty, coriander aroma, citrus, malty, bit stale flavor. Sweet, bready finish, light body.

Looks: amber, very hazy, with white head. Aroma: malt, yeast, orange peel, spices.
Taste: bitter sweet.
Pearly.
Deserves better ratings than it’s receiving simply because it’s a nice smooth easy drinking beer for summer time
Beer dull color. With chemical confectionery aroma zest with some spices. The taste is the same)) I can hardly call it a beer ..

Can, 0.5l. Cloudy yellow pour, one finger soapy white head, short lasting. No lacing. Herbs and lemons on the nose. A bit on the sweet and juicy side.

Thin body, medium carbonation. Average mouthfeel, smooth texture. Taste is mostly on the sweet side with subtle sour notes thrown into the mix. Aroma-wise, not much of a witbier. It's juicy. Very juicy. And quite sweet also. Peach. Apricot. Lemons. Sugar. Perfumy aftertaste. Some spices. Not really picking up much of wheat in there. Lingering juicy sweetnes, a bit sticky mouthfeel. I don't know, really. It's more like a radler to be perfectly honest. Not a bad one but still, a radler.

Drinkable and refreshing, yes, but don't expect true witbier because it's not.

Slightly hazy pale yellow color, distinct smell. Unique taste of citrus, banana and exotic spices. Pleasant aftertaste. Refreshing light wheat beer with a unique taste and a very pretty blue bottle, it really tries not to be beer.
Crisp and refreshing. What else could you want but a lovely bottle of kronenbourg 1664 blanc

As always - a fuck you, also, eat shit for whoever's responsible for the bug that just ate my pretty damn detailed rating for this on desktop.

The actual review, reconstructed:
Bottled., thanks Hana! So, Carlsberg Croatia decided to push this everywhere after the failure of their fake-craft Panonska brand. Including paid "article"-adverts which drew the wrong kind of attention to it. Oh well.

It has a murky golden-yellow body with a white head. The aroma is disturbingly extremely juicy for the style, huge peach juice or something similar, with traces of yeastiness or something. The taste goes the same route, with the peachy juiciness perching on a body with good carbonation and yeasty touches around the edges, some wheaty smoothness. Huh, better than the Panonska beers, but not saying much, this is a beer that will certainly find its niche, and even though it deserves some degree of hate, it's not that bad.

W aromacie kolendra, lekki cytrus i nieprzyjemne, przegniłe/przejrzałe owoce. W smaku trochę za dużo kolendrowych mydlin i za mało wychmielenia. Pojawia się też smak przejrzałych owoców z aromatu. Piwo raczej umiarkowanie udane

Wygląd: barwa słomkowo-jasno-żółta, ładna biała i trwała piana która ładnie zdobi szkło. W smaku sztuczne, słodkie, jedno wymiarowe, puste, totalnie puste, zero jakiegokolwiek drugiego posmaku. Po prostu woda. Piwo do wypicia ale naprawdę mało ciekawe. Dobre nasycenie, dość gładkie, mimo wszystko dość sztuczne i puste. Nie warto moim zdaniem zawracać sobie nim głowę.

330 ml bottle into pint glass, bottled on 4/28/2018. Pours fairly hazy medium golden yellow color with a 2 finger dense and rocky white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice dense soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big lemon, peach, pear, melon, orange zest, red apple, coriander, peppercorn, clove, light banana/bubblegum, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/spicy yeast, spices, pale/wheat malts, and light earthy hop notes; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, peach, pear, melon, orange zest, red apple, coriander, peppercorn, clove, light banana/bubblegum, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Light herbal, floral, grassy, zesty bitterness; yeast/coriander spiciness; and slight wheat tang/tartness on the finish. Lingering notes of lemon, peach, pear, melon, orange zest, red apple, coriander, peppercorn, clove, light banana/bubblegum, wheat, cracker, white bread dough, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/spicy yeast, spices, pale/wheat malts, and light earthy hop flavors; with a solid malt/bitter/spiciness balance, and no cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Fairly crisp/clean finishing. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering bitter/spiciness and carbonation. Medium-high carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, creamy/bready/grainy, and lightly sticky mouthfeel that is fantastic. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is an excellent witbier. All around great fruity/spicy yeast, spices, pale/wheat malts, and light earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink with the mildly bitter/spicy/drying finish. Very flavorful and not watery for the ABV. Awesome balance of Wit yeast complexity, spices, and pale/wheat malts; with solid earthy hop presence/balance. A really enjoyable offering, and spot on style example. One of the better imported Witbiers I've had.

Mein Kronenbourg Blanc war ein ukrainisches Lizenzbier, das sich dort großer Beliebtheit erfreut. Es wird in einer stylischen 0,5l-Flasche aus blauem Glas geliefert.
Optisch ist es trüb wie ein klassisches Witbier und für den klassischen Ukrainer, der nur dieses und das ebenfalls überall verfügbare Hoegaaden kennt, ist es wohl das Nonplusultra eines Witbiers.
Es hat alle Aromen, die ein klassisches Witbier auszeichnen und schießt bei manchen Geschmäckern allerdings weit über das Ziel hinaus. So sind die Gewürznoten nach Kardamon und Nelken sowie Orangenschalen gut eingebaut, was aber stark auffällt ist die unglaubliche Fruchtigkeit: Es schmeckt nach Orange, Ananas, Mango und Banane...und zwar so auffällig, dass es amerikanische Fruit-Ales in den Schatten stellt.
Es ist eigentlich ein interessantes Bier, das mit auch ganz gut gefallen hat. Die Aromentöne könnten aber harmonischer sein.
Egy igazi witbier francia módra. Sokkal citrusosabb és gyümölcsösebb az eredeti witbiertől, de egy remek búzasör és ami meglepő, hogy francia.

Butelka 330 ml. Z wyglądu zewnętrznego - jak woda mineralna i to chyba ma wskazywać na właściwości orzeźwiające. Barwa jasnosłomkowa, nieprzejrzysta, piana i wysycenie dość duże. Takie bez pazura, czuć pszenicę belgijskiego witbiera, goździk, kolendrę; generalnie jak to koncerniak, acz wizualnie rzucający się w oczy. W smaku takie jakby przezroczyste.

以$34罐兩罐(大裝）的價錢在香港的便利店買入，因為當晚是世界盃法國對克羅地亞的比賽。開罐便聞到桃橙味的香氣，看起來像蓋了一層霜霧的香檳般漂亮的金黃色，氣泡強度一般，大概是兩隻手指頭的泡沫，持續一段時間。喝來帶果味，微甜卻帶更明顯一點的檸檬皮的酸味，清新自然。

330ml bottle from Perla in Lazur, drunk overlooking the sea garden in Burgas on a perfect summer afternoon. Pours hazy with a thin frothy head that lasted a minute before settling to a collar of lacing, no visible rising carbonation. Aromas of citrus, sour passion fruit and flowers. In the mouth, high carbonation, some sweetness rising through the palate, flavours of lemon and lime with notes of flowers and cracked wheat, slight crisp sourness, no alcohol presence, thin to medium texture but not watery, leading to a short crisp finish. Overall, perhaps more like an unsweetened shandy than a witbier, but very crisp, refreshing and perfect for the summer.

Light carbonation. A little prickly. Thin, watery texture.

Bière jaune pâle tirant tout de même un peu vers l’orangée, parfaitement voilée, bonne effervescence, et surmontée d’un col blanc immaculé, bien large et très dense, très mousseux, cotonneux même, et qui semble éternel. Arômes de jus d’orange assez franc, avec notes qui me semblent alcoolique et vineuse, bref, ça sent franchement le «cooler à l’orange» (et ça fait un peu peur pour une bière!). Davantage en arrière-plan, on retrouve des effluves plus maltés de pain frais, blé et sucre brut à tendance peut-être mielleux (c’est assez lourd, sirupeux, concentré de jus d’orange…). Enfin, par moment les arômes semblent un peu plus citronné, avec quelque odeurs plus herbacées (coriandre?, houblon?), foin… Pas nécessairement désagréable comme nez, mais un peu douteux pour une bière, complexité plutôt faible (que de jus d’orange!), intensité élevée cependant. En bouche, pétillement moyen sur la langue, onctuosité intéressante au palais, on retrouve bien le velouté typique des bières de blé. Au goût, jus d’orange pétillant, mais plus léger que le nez laissait présager, moins sirupeux, et moins vineux, «cooler». Ça fait longtemps que je n’en ai pas bu, mais ça me fait beaucoup penser à de l’Orangina! Sinon, difficile de déceler d’autres saveurs qui seraient plus typiques d’une bière, peut-être un peu de pain frais, goût légèrement herbacé en arrière-plan, subtile amertume en finale… Comme au nez, ce n’est pas désagréable, mais ce n’est pas ce qu’on s’attend d’une bière (peut-être une «Fruit Beer», certainement pas une «Witbier»!), complexité anémique en bouche, bonne intensité. Bière correcte, sans plus…
