Worst beer I ever tasted. I wont even buy it as a gift for my worst enemies. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
On tap. Good witbier, wich tastes sweet and fruity at the beginning, fresh and light then, no bitter when finished.

I really enjoyed this. It used to be available in bottle form and on draught in most places in the UK up until around 2010. It was maybe too expensive or ahead of its time given the craft beer revolution hadn't really spread at that time. I digress, it's a wheat beer, but is much sweeter and slightly thinner than Germany and Belgium's finest. Typical coriander and sweet lemon drop taste with a hint of barley sugar.

On tap at James Clarke , Sandefjord- Norway. Hazy golden color- good foam. Medium aroma intensity; dominated by pineapple - also some other tropical ( hermetic) fruits. Medium body & complexity . A little on the sweet side. Pretty poor stuff

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Riktigt bra sommaröl, lättdrucken och väldigt läskande. Citrus, blommor, sötma, vete. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very fruit aroma, like strawberries or artificial watermelon flavored candies. Quite sweet, just a touch of hops, a bit yeasty, a bit malty, fruity orange notes. Simple, but an easy crowd-pleaser.
Bottle in wine glass. I found the aroma interesting, although synthetic. The taste is like fabric softener..

This beer is delicate. The aroma is sweet, floral, faintly tropical, but thin. The taste evokes orange but subtly and there is just a dash of spice to mute the citrus element and prevent a radler-like product. Everything is balanced in this beer. -1 for adding caramel color; why?
Tap at a restaurant in Singapore. Hazy light gold pour with a white head. Wheat and spice (coriander). Easy drinker. Not bad.
bottled - summery and refreshing. Nice citrus flavor - similar to blue moon but much better.

Poured from the tap into a 20 OZ mug. The appearance is a hazy light yellow color with a large white head. The aroma is heavy citrus with some spice and a slight maybe yeast smell. The taste is all citrus and a wee bit sour. A real good. beer.

Aroma: lemon and peach.

Sweet flavour but clean.

No sticky sweetness.

Thin bodied.



A smooth (thin) dessert beer.
On tap at local pub. Pours a hazy yellow with average head. Smells citrus-y and wheat-y. Very smooth and tasty beer. Ordered a second straight away.

Bottle at home. Hazy yellow colour, head disappears immediately. Nose is syrupy, sweet, like a gummy bear. Taste is soapy, also gummy-beary raspberry syrup like. The label says it contains orange and cilantro.Almost no carbonation. Too sweet for me, and feels artificial.

Tap@sollerod golfklub. Very haze. Yellow. Fine Ove finger foam. Fruity citrus notes. Savory. Medium mouthfeel and some sourness. Dry finish. A bit Strange. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle @ supermarket. nice looking blue glass, light body, semi carbonated, bit wheaty notes, fresh fruity taste, citrus. I usually don’t like wheat beers, but this product is amazing!!
A less than mediocre witbier. The yeasty spiceness accentuates the overly sweet character of this beer. A lot of bubblegum. Tried with Brandon and Monica at the Dell in 2016.

Jól mutató 0.33-as üveg, szép és érdekes színnel. Az üvegen dombornyomással az 1664-es szám. Kibontás után kellemes szűretlen sörre jellemző illat. Ízleléskor meglepően kellemes gyümölcsös aroma, narancsos beütéssel. Nem tolakodó,nem domináló, hagyja a sör eredeti ízét is érvényesülni, szép fehér habot ad. Összességében ajánlom jól behűtve bármely alkalomra,

33 cl bottle. Hazy, light yellow, thick white head, low carbonataion. Hard to get any aroma past that thick foam, but definately it’s wheat malt in it. Mouthfeel is fizzy and carbonated, really pushes the beer around my palate. Flavours are bubble-gum, banana and fruits. Candy-like sweetness. Some people may love this, for me it’s too fruity, and reminds me more of a radler/shandy-style thing than a witbier.
Bouteille 33 cl- robe jaune pale trouble, belle mousse, côté goût: fruité, trés fruité, amertume inexistante, une bière pour la soif

330ml unusually shaped and colored blue bottle poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is hazy yellow with a medium sized frothy white head that reduced quickly. Aroma and flavours of lemon zest, herbs, banana and spices. Taste is light-medium sweet and medium bitter. 1664 Blanc is overall a balanced and quite tasty beer.
,5l from tap into 1664 glass in Kazakhstan. Wit nose. Crisp light body. Solidly wit taste. Nothing incredible, but not a bad example of the style.
On tap at L’Alambic. Hazy yellow with a thin veil of white foam. Flavors are wheat, lemon, orange peel, orange Crush soda and sugar with spicy notes. Light body, moderate carbonation, watery texture.
Pear, coriander, citrus. It does not taste like a normal lager. More like a fruit beer.
Flaske 0,33L fra Polet Jekta, Uklar strålgul med hvitt skum. Sitrusaroma. Frisk, sitrus, tropisk, banan. sommer. En veldig god lett drikkelig witbeer,.anbefales
Gulbrun med fint, tett skum. Svak duft med lett krydder og noe sitrus. Også svak smak med noe honningmelon og et fint floral preg på slutten. Behagelig karbonisering.

Nincs túl nagy habja, az is gyorsan eltűnik. Illata citromos, korianderes, mást nem is érezni. A citrom és a koriander dominál az ízében is. Sörös jelleget csak a háttérben, és ott is gyengén ad. Keserűsség még jelzés értékűségében is csak gyengén jelenik meg. Utóízében is a citrom és a koriander dominál, és nagyon gyorsan lecseng.
wheat cloudy gold white head heavy lacing. Aroma of citrus and bread. Flavors of lemon, bread light yeast. No bite but pleasant cooling hot weather drink
"Blanche" très portée sur le côté fruité, à tel point que l’on doute du naturel de la chose. Bizarrement la levure est assez présente pour une telle bière. Désaltérante, certes, mais vite écoeurante.
500ml can from a 7-11 on Jinmen, Taiwan. Pours hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of lemon and orange. Tinny taste, almost an alcopop. Sweet finish.

Bottle from Sprout’s: Poured a glowing yellow with white tint and appeared similar to lemonade minus the large white foam head presented on top. Aroma is mild and has a fragrant scent of tangerine or orange peels with a pinch of ground coriander. The flavor of the beer is both sweet and fruity bringing about tastes of peach and tangerine with a backing of hearty wheat malting. Has an aftertaste that reminded of the flavor of rose water.

This blanc poured a light, cloudy yellow colour with a big,bright white head. Scents include citrus, spice and very light hops. First swig was a little watery and had flavours of a typical wheat beer, citrus and spice. Finish was wheat and orange citrus.

330 ml bottle poured at the creperie in Edmonton. Pours a cloudy yellow with a white head that dies out quickly. Smells like grapefruit. Taste is sweet with grapefruit and pineapple. Very fresh. Good beer.

Pours yellow with creamy top. A lot fruits in quite strong aroma. Mango, pineapple, banana, lemon and other tropical fruits. Taste follows, but is weaker than aroma. However, quite sweet and fruity. Nice sweet and easy beer!

Pours pale yellow with a thick white head. Sweet and citrusy (orange and lemon) taste. Abit too thin for me.

Had a few in Paris during my Europe trip Jun 2015 (super hot weather that time 34°C), so when ever I had one it reminds me of Paris.

On tap @ Sheremetyevo Airport, Moscow. Pours hazy yellow, white foam, kind of like I would expect a witbier to look like. Aroma is very perfume, too perfume actually, there is some orange peel and bubblegum. Taste is also very orange-forward, I wonder if they are using too much extract to get this flavour? Does feel artificial and too sweet. Also, I am drinking this in Moscow, so I am quite sure that this was not brewed in France but somewhere in Russia by Baltika (Carlsberg). Doesn’t really feel like a beer but more like some beer cocktail to be honest.

A refreshing a crisp spring/summer beer. Nice aroma and appearance with good, lasting head and lacing. Taste is fruity like peaches and lemonade but something different than both of those. Figs perhaps. Agree with another reviewer who said that the taste was artificial. It’s not a bad flavor, though. On the finish, I detect a hint of coriander on the palate and some sour acidity. Was not expecting such a beer from this brewer. Would buy again.
Blue 33 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours pale yellow with a thick white head. Sweet aroma and citrusy taste. Good refreshing beer but with a slightly artificial aftertaste.

0,33l bottle. Pale, little hazy yellow colour with quickly dispearing creamy white head. Aroma: Citrus, fruity, yeasty. Taste: Sweet malts, citrus, banana, slightly bitter, some sourness is hiding. Light body, medium carbonation. A bit sour but pleasent finish. At summer it’s great light drinking beer. Refreshing.

Flaska hos syrran. 
Dimmig ljusgul vätska med vitt skum. 
Doftar friskt av citrus och koriander. 
Mycket fräsch och lättdrucken. Noll beska, men fin sötma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

As a complete beer novice, this has been my first introduction to beer (that I have actually enjoyed). Would recommend to late bloomers and those who have sworn off beer. Very light bodied, thin, and carbonated with citrus overtones and a hint of coriander.
30 Dec 2015, can. pale yellow, a bit hazy. nose is sweet, a bit yeasty, tropical fruit and lemon. med/thin body and mildly fizzy. fruity, lemon rind, faintly fizzy, faintly skunky. ok.
Hazy straw yellow pour with creamy white head. Surprisingly good lacing with aroma of skunk and grass. Sweet flavor with fruit, sugar, and touch of skunk. Worst beer I’ve had in a while.

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy pale straw, medium size head, good lacing. Weak aroma of grass and fruit. Watery and light mouthfeel. Watery and thin taste with hints of banana, coriander and lemonade.

Bottle. Hazy light yellow with huge white head, lots of lacings. Sweet aroma of lemonade, stone fruit, peaches, sugar. Sweet lemonade taste with minimal bitterness, juicy character. Light to medium body, light to medium carbo. Lemonade like beer.

Bottke 0.46 / Российская лицензия, за авторством "Балтики"
Ужасно. Сплошная химия. Сладкое нечто для девочек.

Pale unfiltered lemony colour with a full foamy white head. Smells of peaches and stone fruit and refined sugar. Lots of peaches in the first taste. Light and Bubbly sweet tanginess. Finishes with fruity aftertaste.

Bottle. Sugary and citrusy, lemon candy nose, some citrus rind and oil. Hazy pineapple juice color, thin film head. Light citrus initial, powdered sugar, very light banana note, and a thin dry finish. Thin body. Kind of middle-of-the-road stuff. Fairly refreshing but also limp and not very wit-ty.

Bouteille(Merci, monsieur le professeur!):Pale yellowish coloured, cloudy. Quichly collapsing small white head; herbs, bubble-gum and a kind of artificial flavours in the nose; moderate sweet-sourish flavour, light bodied but nevertheless sticky; citrus-fruits and bubble-gum in the sticky sweetish finish. A minor pleasure…

I tried this for the first time last week and really enjoyed it. Bought more for this weekend. I’m not a pro reviewer (or beer connoisseur ) but I definitely enjoyed drinking this beer. Smell good, tastes great. It did run a little pricey at $10 for a six pack.
Bottle. Aroma: a bit hops and malt, some artificial orange. Taste: sweet, lemon, orange zest, spicy.
Well the blue bottle is kind of pretty I guess. Way too sweet, Witbier/lager it tasted like? Not great. Serving: Bottle
Apricot smell very good and quite strong! Cloudy appearance... Taste isn’t quite as good as smell...touch of bitterness... One dimentional though...meh

The aroma bright tones of grapefruit and peel, which are generally sacrificed everything else. Against the background unless looked through some cereal notes.
In taste citrus acidity, cereal sweetness, again the same saturated orange and grapefruit tones. Bitterness weak that combines the grassy and zest.
The aftertaste citric acidity, bitterness becomes a little harder next immutable grapefruits and oranges.

From tap at Melkebaren with UKM 13.10.15. Hazy pale yellow/greyish. Dense and persistent white head and lacing. Aroma of lemon and green banana. Taste of wine gum, citrus juise and pinaple. Canned pineapple in aftertaste. A bit waterish
it tastes sweet and fruity at the beginning, fresh and light then, no bitter when finished

Tallahassee, Fl - ABC Fine Wine & Spirits - Bull Run - 12 oz blue bottle. Hazy light golden pour, fluffy snow white head, nice lacing. Yeasty aroma, hint of lemon. Refreshing flavor, some coriander, citrusy lemon, some yeasty accents. Crisp mouthfeel.

Draught at Cock’s and Cow’s, Østerbro (yes, that’s a burger restaurant...). Hazy, almost milky golden colour with a bubbly, white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, bubblegum, banana, apples, spicy hints and wheat malts. Taste is lightly sweet. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and fruity with light yeasts and lemon. Fresh.OK.

Short living head.
Aroma: harsh spicy ethers, perfume, sweet rotten apricots, some zest.
Taste: light sweeteness, light to moderate sourness, light bitterness and astrigency.
Flavour: rotten apricots, zest, strong perfume notes like aromat soap or bath gel.

Strange and overperfumed.

Appearance: hazy straw with one finger of dense creamy white head, excellent retention and good lacing. (4/5) Aroma: sweet orange, raspberry, caramel, wheat, coriander. (5/10) Taste: moderately strong sweet, mild bitter, light tart. (4/10) Palate: light body, moderate-low carbonation, short duration finish. (3/5)

This starts off fairly inoffensive, but the glucose and fruit flavour get to be a bit sickly after a while. Not terrible, but not great, either. I’d feel a bit annoyed at having bought a six-pack of this, were it not for the fact that a) it’s not bad on a the patio on a warm day, and b) She Who Must Be Obeyed sorta likes it. (10/20)

Yuck. Hazy yellow pou, funky fruity aroma. Off flavour of wheats and moldy fruits. This was a fresh can so had to have been just a crap beer. Kronenbourg has some ok stuff so this just wasn’t one of them.

50cl from tap@Oslo Mekaniske Verksted in 1664 Blanc glass@approx 7 degrees C. Pours hazy yellow white head with sufficient retention. Aroma of orange, lemon and grass. Fruity flavour of lemon, peach, orange, apricot and bubblegum with a hint of wheat thrown in. Medium/light bodied with medium carbonation. I had expected a witbier but this was much more like a more alcoholic radler without the edge of yeast of a regular wit. Refreshing, but somewhat bland and artificial and not very interesting. A beginnes wit?
Mousse blanche, couleur jaune pâle, bel arôme agrumes, orange? Goût agrumes, est-ce bien une bière? Enfin cela désaltère. En pression, 25 Cl dans une brasserie à Paris.
Pours in cloudy strax yellow tone with a ting white head. Aroma of yeast, pinapple and scent of candy. The taste consists of alot of pinapple and well carbonated..
Tap at bastant, Bergen. Bubblegum and fizz, a hint of oranges and some spearmint. Not nice.

Bottle. Cloudy straw with a white head. Aroma of oranges, coriander, pineapple, a little cardboard. Watery. Moderate carbonation. Quite bland, no twang from the wheat at all. Not much lemon, coriander is there along with orange and lots of pineapple. Almost no bitterness, slightly astringent at the end. Weird and not very pleasant.
500 ml can. Pale yellow, huge creamy white head. Aroma of orange juice, pineapple. Taste is a weak mix of sweetness and bitterness. Body is very weak, carbonation below average.

Great beer to mix with summersbe. It poured a hazy straw yellow with a slightly more than one finger white head that dissipates within a minute leaving stringy lacing. Fruity aromas of orange, banana and peach with honey floating about and a light citrusy lemon wheat backbone. Flavors are mainly peachy with hints of fruity lemon, banana and apricot. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Overall, it is light, crisp and very easy to drink. It is refreshing on a hot summers day especially with the nice peachy flavors.
Aroma is yeast, childrens foam candy and a particle of pineapple? Taste is sweet and fruity, with some lemon and coriander. Thin and uniteresting brew.

BOTTLE 50 CL by Carlsberg Ukraine. 4,8% abv. Murky pale yellow, creamy white head. Aroma of cheap apricot and/or citrus flavoured bubble gum. The taste has the same flavourings, rotten cabbage, prickly carbonation. A touch of lightly bitter astringency in the finish. No orange peel or coriander. Horrible, though the blue glass bottle looks cool indeed.

A 330ml blue bottle with a best before date of April 2016 and poured into a pint glass. It poured a hazy straw yellow with a slightly more than one finger white head that dissipates within a minute leaving stringy lacing. Fruity aromas of orange, banana and peach with honey floating about and a light citrusy lemon wheat backbone. Flavours are mainly peachy with hints of fruity lemon, banana and apricot. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Overall, it is light, crisp and very easy to drink. It is refreshing on a hot summers day especially with the nice peachy flavours.

Pours a hazy pale yellow color, topped with a medium white head, slowly settling down. Mild aroma, but wit heasily picked up lemons and some spices. Taste is sweet, citrusy with some spices in the finish. Not the best witbier, but certainly decent enough.

500 ml can from U Express, drunk by Canal St-Martin as the locals do. Cloudy gold with a foamy white head. The nose is cotton candy, the taste is sweet cotton candy and candied orange. Strangely artificial but not terrible.

Nor my first choice of beer, but it is also a matter of context. This is more or less a wheat beer shandy. Orange aroma/appearance with some wheat beer aspects covered by a very orange cordial flavour.
Drinking this though in 32 degree heat in humid Singapore makes it strangely appealing.
0,5 can.Medium head.Pale lemon juice colour. Aroma is peach and orange. Small coriander taste with artificial sweet grapefruit . Struggled to finish.Awful

Bottled, 33 cl.
Opal yellow colour, medium sized creamy white head.
Nose of lemon zest.
Aroma has lemon zest underpainted by some bread and hints of coriander, texture is slick.
Rather sweet, mild lemony finish.
Pours thick white head with good lacing and hazy golden color. Aromas of citrus, peach and coriander. Taste is sweet and somewhat bitter. Quite well balanced refreshing beer.
Yellowish color; big white head after pouring. Lemon , coriander in the aroma. It’ a little bit to sweet and is dominated mainly by artificial aromas.
Hazy yellow color ; big , white head. Malt , lemon , coriander in the aroma. Sweet taste with artificial citrus notes and spices . Too sweet, even for witbeer.

12oz bottle. Hazy yellow-tan body. Very nice fluffy, steady head. I get a lot of fruity zest in the aroma. It carries over into the flavor, milder though. Nice and yeasty. There is a touch of oddness, but I’d guess that is the orange peel. A pretty respectable offering.  There is kind of an artificial lemonade/radler feel going, which brings it down for me.
Melegben gyorsan lecsúszik! Kicsit limonádés ízvilág! Illatában lehet érezni a narancshéjat + a koriandert!

Notes from recent Denver trip: Hazy yellow pour, fluffy white head, light lace. Nose is muted spice. Bittersweet. Middle is light wheat, mixed grain, orange, light spice. Finish is dry and grainy. Better than I expected.

Unclear yellow. White small head, decent lacing. Aroma of sweet fruit, citrus, floral and herbs. Taste is sweet orange, pine, coreander and yeast. Low bitterness, high carbonation. Very fresh, but the sweetness is to high.
Can - cloudy pale yellow with thin white head. Little carbonation. Decent aroma - citrus and peaches? Ok in mouth and on tongue - taste peachy./lemon. Fairly still feel, quite refreshing.

Bottle 0,33.
Pale yellow with small head. Aroma: fruits, spices, soapy notes. Taste: wheat, weak salty. Refreshing.

Limonade « avec une pointe d’agrumes », dixit le « brasseur ».
Je l’ai prise en accompagnement d’un melon suivi d’une salade de crudités.
Le melon était bien meilleur, et la salade a dépassé largement...
Mes points (puisqu’il faut en donner nécessairement sur ratebeer) vont à la couleur de la bouteille,
d’un joli bleu océanique. (Normal, c’est de l’eau).

Bottle on sale from a supermarket in Holland. The beer is hazy yellow colored and pours a large and stable white head, with livingly CO2. When opening the bottle, lemon comes into your nose, followed by a fruity palate with tones of citrus and a hint of coriander. The taste is very fruity and light sour, with a pleasant bitterness in the end. The finish is refreshing and light bitter. Good, a little watery though and too much lemon, but it’s actually not bad.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour. Sweet flavour. Lemon, bubblegum, coriander, better than expected

Ingredients - ..., glucose syrup, aromatic caramel, flavour (?), hop extract, sweet orange peel, spice coriander; well at least they’re honest. Forewarned on what to expect!
Hazy, straw yellow with a lasting, satin sheened pad of white atop. Smells sweet, candyish with soft banana, pastelles, lemon curd atop a bready, doughy base. Super sweet; like a lemonade with a gammy, tangy finish that twists and contorts the tongue. Sour down the sides with a drabby, cardboard mid-palate to really mix things up. Really difficult to drink. Soapy, plastic and slightly chemical finish that seems to lather the tongue. Awkward and cringing. My weekend has brought nothing but sorrow as far as beers tasted. Could not sink much lower! (33cL, BB 09/09/15, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

Bottle. Thanks finol.
Pours pale hazy yellow, white head
Aroma of fresh satsuma and grape 
Sweet taste of perfume and synthetic orange and flowers. Slightly under carbonated. 
Summer fresh and surprisingly likable

Bottle from Systembolaget. 
Pours hazy yellow. 
Heavy sweet with some herbs and banana.
Bottle at Epcot. Cloudy yellow with a lasting white head and good lacing. Aroma of citrus, coriander, and grain. Taste is a little too sweet and lightly spiced. Light bodied and slightly dry.

Hazy pale golden color with a white head with short to medium duration. Aroma has notes of light citrus with slightly yeasty notes. Flavor is slightly sweet, medium maltiness. Creamy and smooth on palate.

0,46 bottle. Pours hazy yellow color with small white head, mostly diminishing. Sweet artificial aroma of citrus, spices. Flavor is medium to high sweet, light bitter. Aftertaste is short and malty. Light to medium body , lively carbonation. Nothing too exciting.
A: Passionfruit, mango, wheat. Slight yeast. T: Taste follows nose well. A bit more of the passionfruit. Hint of banana. O: Surprisingly nice summer beer!

On tap, poured into a shaker. The aroma is a mellow, creamy banana, with vanilla and a grassy note. It pours a murky banana pale with a dense, white foam head and good retain. The beer is a medium sweetness. The beer is light creamy and smooth with flavors of light lemon, grass, banana, and vanilla with a finish that’s clean and grassy with a light spice and leaves and aftertaste of clove.

330 ml bottle. Cloudy, pale yellow colour, short-life medium sized off-white head, slight lemony and syrupy aroma, light body, soft carbonation, sour wheaty and sweet malty taste, fruity (lemon and orange peel) palate with very moderate hoppy bitterness. Not bad.

On tap at the John B Pub in Coquitlam. A pale yellow color, cloudy, indicating it might be a decent wit. Moderate white head and faintly citrus fruity nose. Tasting confirms it's closer to a citrus fruit cooler than a beer. Pleasantly insipid. 2.1


A tall can from BC Liquor stores. That was then (2015) and this is now, about 2 years later. Maybe I was a bit harsh back then, or maybe I was more of a beer snob back then. Anyway I've upgraded this one to pleasantly fruity, and better than the average macro beer. 2.7
Весьма вкусный вит, цена не кусучая, можно брать.
Vycap Shanghai. Zlta farba, biela pena. Vona sladka bananova, jemne pikantna, ostra. V chuti sladkost, banany, trosku koriander, pikantnost na jazyku. Celkom pitelne a osviezujuce.
Une des pires blanches que j’ai bu de ma vie, arômes de produit de vaisselle au citron vert et bouche sucrée digne d’un fanta citron à éviter

Served from tap in a Kronenbourg 1664 glass at the Le Comptoir des Negociants bar (Ax-les-Thermes, France, 16 V 2015). A hazy, yellow white beer with nice citrus flavours. The taste is full of citrus and pineapple, with distinctive spicy notes. A good yet very sweet wheat beer: Not that bitter, strong in malts, light bodied.

And Boheem, Tallinn. Hazy yellow with a small, white head. Surprisingly fruity aroma, seems a bit artificial and more towards pineapple than banana. Sweet and fruity and more soda like than beer, but still quite drinkable and somewhat refreshing.
Uklar gul med lavt skum. Aroma av sitron og noe tropisk frukt. Smaken er sitron og noe frukt. Tynn konsistens.

Poured from a 25cl bottle into a tall weissbier glass. Nice head that lingers. Pours merky, yellow, pineapple juice-like in the glass. Strong, peachy aroma. Taste of citrus, banana, wheat and lemon. Short palate. One of the best weissbiers around and that?s a huge surprise. Being French and all...
Pint on tap at Harry’s, Clarke Quay. Smells of peaches, looks like pineapple juice with small head. Chalky zingy mouthfeel with sour bitterness. Finish is pepper & pineapple. Nice in hot weather.
330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with light head. Light arias if coriander and wheat. Flavors are same with some goral notes. A light witbier.
Enjoyed at BTBF 2015. Slightly cloudy yellow color. Suite for the nose. Fruity and used grain flavor, lightly dry.

How: Bottle.

Where: Himlen, Stockholm.

Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.

Aroma: Citrus, wheat, some estery fruit.

Body: Light body, medium carbonation.

Flavour: Citrus, wheat.

Sampled from a 11.2 oz blue bottle this beer poured a murky peach color with a huge creamy-soapy yellow-white head that lingered and left decent lacing. The aroma was tangy, musty, orange, lemon, bread dough, pineapple and peach. The flavor was very sweet orange, honey, peach, pineapple, apricot and must.Medium length finish. Medium body. Lovely.
Had this at a large tasting event. Pleasantly surprised. Bright with some citrus and floral notes. Long lasting rich head. Will buy often now that it is warmer outside.
Bottle 0,33L price: 0,75€. Can 0,5L/ 0,87€ Citrusiniu vaisiu kvapas, švelnaus skonio alus

Aromat słodki, owocowy, najbardziej kojarzy się z morelą, lekkie goździki. Barwa słomkowa, piwo mętne, piana średnia, całkiem ładny lacing. W smaku ciekawe, także na pierwszy plan wychodzi słodka morela lub jakieś owoce kandyzowane, lekko winne. Ciekawe, inne, trochę za słodkie, ale ogólnie ok. Warka do 03.2015

Bottle.

A- Lemons, citrus, wheat, subtle spice.

A- Light yellow color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Lemon cleaner, wheat, subtle spice, citrus.

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, refreshing finish.

O- Not bad but still room for being better. I expected more of an orange flavor not so much lemon. Almost felt like a shandy. The spice was very subtle and it had a slight cleaner smell and taste. But I would still definitely drink this on a hot day.

3/3 (Bottle) - Pale pour with a nice citrus aroma. Texture light and crisp, minimal carbonation. Taste was pleasent lemon and pear based. Not very strong, but an OK beer to pair with food or when one wants to drink a light beer.
On draft at the Hard Rock Cafe Singapore. Don’t do it. It’s a sweeter, fruitier version of Hoegaarden. The French should stick to Champagne.
Ljusgul grumlig med stort vit skum. Doftar och smakar lite citrus och något konstigt. Ganska tråkig
Pint at faber peak singapore cloudy citrus fruity refreshing & tasty much better than expected

Robe blonde et trouble. La mousse ne tient pas.
Saveurs fruitées (poire et pêche). Courte en bouche.
Une blanche industrielle correcte.

Pours a cloudy golden straw topped by a two finger bright frothy head showing moderate retention and leaving some chunky lacing. The nose is big on orange peel and coriander. The taste is bold orange with a touch of spice though a medium body holding good carbonation. Not overly sweet or too bitter, the finish lets the hops deliver more citrusy features. Almost juice-like, this brew is perfect for pairing with white fish or fresh salads. Cheers!
At Wit does not look like a classic. More like juice. Orange peel, coriander felt. I like it.
Superb - along with Hoegaarden a favourite of mine. Extremely refreshing, citrus with a hint of the exotic.
Flaska systembolaget. Disig gulblek kulör med vitt fluffigt skum. Friskt brödig doft med tydlig aprikostouch. Mjuk och relativt vattnig smak med vete och frukt. Aprikospure och äpple. Låg beska
Pours hazy golden colour with good head.Huge Orange nose. Solid mouthfeel, well carbonated. Orange dominates the flavours
From a bottle. Pours cloudy straw colour, tiny lasting head, good example of style. I liked it.

Bottle, 33cl / Botella, 33cl.
@ Carrefour San Fernando, Cadiz, Spain.
A: Cloudy Golden / Dorado muy claro
T/S: Pineapple, Fruity, Citrus / Piña, afrutado, citrico.
Lätt gyllengul, grumlig med vit skumkrona. Doft av söt lemonad. Lätt smak av citrus och apelsinsaft.
A hazy yellow pour. Flavor of pineapple and a orange. Really light and refreshing.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma of apricot and pear with a hint of coriander. Light body, slick feel, average carbonation. Mild and sweet taste of citrus, but with a metallic feel and abrupt finish. Not really what I’d call a wit, and it doesn’t quite live up to it’s alluring smell. Still, I guess it’s OK as a summer refreshment.

On tap, 25cL. @Strasbourg, restaurant "Au Canon", with sauerkraut. A pale yellow opaque beer with medium white head ; medium retention, good lacing. Aroma of lemon and peach. Light sweet, light bitter dry refreshing. Light body, thin texture, good carbonation, bittersweet refreshing finish. Overall, OK refreshing fruity witbier.

Appearance: cool blue glass bottle; pours cloudy light orange, with a fizzy, creamy white head that’s rather dense.  Aroma: overpowering aroma of peaches (extract?), hint of green apple, everything else is a muddled undertone.  Taste: artificial sweet-tart peach flavors dominate; under all is a hint of crackery wheat.  Finish: 	lingering peach, decent palate, maybe a hint of orange zest? Notes: Someone took an average witbier and spiked the hell out of it with peach syrup. Lousy.

Bottle from the only cafe. Hazy gold-straw body with a thin foamy white head, traditional wit appearance. Heavy over-ripe peach aroma, some orange zest, orange, more tropical than most of the style. Subtle tartness, medium-bodied, lightly hopped. Normal alcohol level.
Peu friand des produits de cette brasserie mais cette blanche fruitée et florale passe très bien. Sucrée très rafraîchissante. Bouteille bue en brasserie, Noisy-le-Grand, France, le 27/07/2014.
Tuscan Rooftop ontap(16-Dec-2014)Big sweet orange aroma.Cloudy amber,ok head&suds lace.Sweet orange flavour.Orange candy herbal finish&light herbal aftertaste.
Pours a light yellow cloudy wit style, with a small diminishing head, aroma was very fruity with good hints of floral hops, I was knocked back by the sweetness when drinking it danced on the tongue
Pours cloudy like a wit. Mild aroma of orange and orange peel. Tastes quite orangey. Orange flavour starts to taste artificial after a few sips. In the end, drinkable.

12 ounce bottle. Pours an unclear golden yellow with a thin white head that lasts. Taste is of wheat, citrus, spice and malt. Similar aroma. Ha a decent body with a citrus finish. Easy to drink, but is missing something.

4.5% ABV, brewed in St. Petersburg. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a medium sized white head that fades to a halo. But if lacing. Nice aroma of apricot jam a coriander. Taste is citrus with balanced sweetness and sourness. Smells better than it tastes but overall drinkable.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma of apricot and pear with a hint of coriander. Light body, slick feel, average carbonation. Mild and sweet taste of citrus, but with a metallic feel and abrupt finish. Not really what I’d call a wit, and it doesn’t quite live up to it’s alluring smell. Still, I guess it’s OK as a summer refreshment.

330 ml. bottle. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of fruit and spice. Taste is stone fruit, citrus, spice, grain, and yeast. Might have been an old bottle, had some metallic taste to it. Tried to take that into account.

Light yellow, weak sweetish aroma of citrus and spices, light sweetness, light sourness, almost non existent bitterness, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, short sweet finish,Overall: Refreshing but not very tasty and quite boring

-- rated with beerbasher
Great summer wheat beer. Old Belgian Wit beer recipe with citrus, giving it a fresh fruity flavour. My favorite summertime thirst quencher...

Poured from bottle, pale hazy yellow with low creamy head. Aroma with very faint notes of cereal and fruit(apple/elderberry). Taste is very mild and lots of CO2 carry notes of citrus and grass, faint banana notes. Refreshing sweet sour after taste. Very much like a good lemonade :-)
Bottle 33cl. Too much transparent for witbier. The smell is not bad - very nice apricot smell, but nothing interesting more... . After few minutes apricot disappears. Only mass product.

(On tap) Cloudy yellow with ok white head. Prominent fruity floral aroma with lemon, pineapple and passion fruit. Medium body with smooth carbonation. Initial tats is tropical fruit punch with a little very light malt sweetness and some slight peppery bitterness. Overall, refreshing.
On tap. Hazy. Foamy head. Light. Aroma is fruit, citrus, candy, leaves, mango. Taste is dry sweet fruity corn.
Dunkel hvitaktig farve med lyst skum. Lukt av aprikos, pære og koriander. Smak av aprikos og pære. Søt lemonade ettersmak. Tap @ Melkebaren.

Keg Budapest. White yellow ok head. Aroma is lemon. Taste is nice lemon citrus malts. Medium body. I really enjoyed this after a full day drinking session nice beer to finish off after starting at 10am and finishing about 4:30 am the following day with a few of these!!!
500ml on tap. Aroma is hay, grassy, algae. Appearance is cloudy orange with a light foam. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Soft carbonation. Little mouth feel. Well, not very good.
decent witbier...crisp, clean, and refreshing. Not very complex, but that wasn’t exactly expected. not bad...

250ml blue bottle served in a chalice.
A: Pours a very pale yellow color. Cloudy. Forms a big aired and bubbled white off head. Medium to low retention leaving some lacings in the glass
S: Very citrus in the nose. Strong orange and lemony zest. Sweet grains and wheat. Bready yeasts and mild flowery hops in the end
T: Follows the nose. Sweet grains upfront with strong notes of orange zest and wheat. Refreshing. Very mild hops bitternerness in the very end
M: Light to medium body. Good carbonation. Sweet bread and citrus aftertaste
O: Very drinkable. Easy drinking and refreshing. Perhaps a bit artificial tate but a good summertime beer
[ BA Review @ 12/27/2012 ]

33cl from the draft somehwere in Conflans (France.)

Apperarance Hazy yellow color with small white head. 
Aroma: Wheat, and citrus, light peaches and herbs.
Taste: lemon, and peaches upfront light coriander and wheat in the back , clove in taste., sweeter and more lemonade like then a Good Belgian 
thin-medium body (thin compared to a good German Weizen), soft carbonation.

Like a lemonade version of Hoegaarden.
Frisk duft av hvete, appelsin og sitron. Dunkel gul farge. Dekkende hvitt skum, heng langs kant. Frisk amak av hvete med en sittende ettersmak av appelsin.

From a bottle. White in color. Heavy caramel malts. Drank with an orange slice. Better beer than I thought!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle kindly shared by MisoW, thanks. Hazy yellow color with small white head. Wheat, citrus in aroma. Wheat, lemon, coriander, clove in taste. OK.
Bottle from MisoW. Seriously light-struck oxidated, coriander. Hazy yellow colour. White head. Taste is mostly OK, light light-struck, coriander, honeyish sweetness. Acceptable for refreshment.

Bottle from McTapps, thank you Sabine. Pours hazy yellow color, white head. Aroma of coriander, lemon, orange. Taste is medium sweet, lightly sour, orange, coriander, tangerines. Better than expected :)

Bouteille 33cl, @ l’annif de ma cousine en Suisse.
Retours là les grandes lignes des grosses prod industrielles, sans âme, sans saveur, bref on s’emmerde à mort.
Une couleur paille léger trouble, bouquet blanc.
Arôme est basique dans les grandes lignes des blanches mais sans innover. Léger citronné sur une pointe de coriandre, froment perceptible.
Palais reste très léger et on note que rien n’est fait pour mettre un des ingrédients en avant. Ici encore, malt, froment, citronné petite pointe d’écorce et coriandre, sans plus. Reste correcte, mais pq boire cela quand y a tellement de meilleures alternatives. Vaut juste la moyenne.
Nice refreshing beer with aroma of peaches and vanilla. Malty taste of peaches. Slightly bitter in the aftertaste

Sample at The Brew Kettle on 9/14/14. Clear yellow/blanc color with a thick white head. Aroma of malt, lemon, peach and slight herbs. Malty flavor with big peach character before a mildly sweet finish.

33cl bottle. Tastes like witbier shandy. Aroma of shampoo and the taste of a tutti-frutti shampoo as well. But this is somewhat good and intriguing. Beer is refreshing, interesting and fun. Not a witbier in its original meaning. I had it several years ago, and remembered it as being more "Hoegaarden with lemonade". Fitted well as a side to ham pizza.

Alors, Louis me reçoit chez lui pour l’anniversaire de sa petite. Il m’ouvre la porte du frigo et m’offre le choix. Je choisi celle-ci. Il est étonné et me traite de feu-fille. C’est ça les cotes... La bouteille est bleue? Alors, elle est belle cette Blanc. Blonde bien trouble à la mousse crémeuse, pratiquement comme une meringue. Le nez est bien étrange, ça sent l’ananas à plein nez, mais de façon artificielle. Il y a certes d’autre odeurs comme le citron et encore-là, ça ressemble à du dessert. C’est plus ou moins épouvantable en bouche. Un gâteau aux ananas renversé, poivré, minéral et citronné, mais tout ça est faux. Première et dernière fois. (1224-060614)
Short White head with notes of light grapefruit. Clear opaque yellow body. Feels like white beer but tastes like grapefruit juice with less sugar.

330 ml blue bottle served in a snifter. 

Aroma: lihtly spicy with a pronounced note of ripe arpicot. 
Orange and apricot dominate the flavor, with some wheat underneath.

Soft lively carbonation nicely complements the medium-light body. 

O: a soft, French vounterpart to Magic Hat #9

330ml bottle from local Albert Heijn supermarket. Pale yellow with a full white soapy head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Very present synthetic sweetness with some small bitter tones. Citrus, metallic/acidic tones, yeast and some peach. Way too synthetic to be a good white beer.

Bottle. Poured 9/16/14. Cloudy gold with active carbonation and a thick, meringue-like, white head. Aroma is peaches, wheat, Belgian yeast, grass, some spice, very sweet; smells fun. Taste is sweet, tart, peach, slightly creamy, some bread, hay; finish is abruptly dry with a long peach finish. Lacing is dense and throughout. While initially very active, the carbonation is fairly low. Mouth feel is light-bodied. Surprising how enjoyable this is. Crank up the carbonation (maybe even champagne yeast?), get rid of the added caramel color, add coriander, orange peel, and a noticeable hop profile and this would be really nice.

Sampled on draft in a Moscow restaurant. Cloudy light yellow appearance with a good white head. Zesty aromas of wheat, lemon and lime. Taste is rather sweet and uninspiring. Some citrus but also something rather harsh and slightly metallic, perhaps some artificial flavour? Not really enough bitterness, and completely lacking in the banana, coriander or cloves flavour that you would expect from a good wit beer. This beer is industrial, and whilst it is refreshing, it is a pretty poor example of a wit beer.

Not anything to write home about but refreshing nonetheless 

Pours hazy gold with light head.

Citrus and wheat on the palate with high effervescence and light body, there's lots of carbonation and just no a whole lot of flavor.

I'd take it any day over a domestic.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl Bottle from AH. Thank God I didn’t have to buy a whole 6-pack. Hazy pale yellow colour, dense white head. Looks fine. Aroma is very sweet, artificial, aspartame, orange peel, lime. Flavour is sweet, aspartame, orange peel, coreander, some wheat, sweet finish. Light-bodied, creamy mouthfeel.
Can from French supermarket. Cloudy yellow with a thin white head. The lemon and coriander combine to give a distinct grapefruit flavour. Light refreshing and not at all bad.

500 ml can from Broue Ha Ha, served cold in a tulip glass. 



App.: Murky straw yellow with a fluffy, bright white head.
 
Aroma: Strong lemon zest, some earthy/citrusy coriander, a little wheat/yeast fighting for attention.
 
Palate: Medium body, somewhat relaxed carbonation for a kinda slick, greasy overall impression.
 
Flav.: Lots ’o lemon, a bit of coriander, toasted wheat, a little bubble gum ester action; dry with minimal bitterness and a fairly long, very lemony finish.



Drinkable. Not a shining example of the style.

33 cl bottle at a friend’s birthday party. Pours like a decent witbier, yellow, cloudy, with a nice creamy white head with good retention and lacing. Aroma’s are sweet, wheat, lime. Artificial aroma’s retronasal, notably tropical fruit. Flavor is moderate sweet, with some fruity sourness. Light bodied. Drinakble, but the artificial flavor put me off a bit.

Hazy yellow with small white head. Lemon, light yeast and spices, some faint grains and dough. Medium bodied with creamy feel. Quite sweet, almost radler like. Not too bad but bit lemonade like and too sweet/artificial.
Bottle. Pale blonde, cloudy. Citric, herbal, perfumed aroma. Coreander. Wheaty, sweetish, citric perfumed flavor. Thinnish. Drinkable.

Wow, blue bottle: served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized white head. Hazy bright yellow colored.
Smelly cardboard with lemon soda and some fruity manure...
Flavour is mostly soap water with hints of cardboard, lemon, some bitters and grains.
Aftertaste is quite dull and unbalanced lemon and malts with a fake herbal sweet ish touch.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, low to medium bodied and a light creamy texture.
Fruity (citrus) and very sweet (berry). Very cloudy and the citrus and a hint of banana lingers at the end. Good summer beer, a mix between a typical white beer and a hefeweizen.

Cervesa dolceta i aromàtica, molt refrescant i fàcil de beure.
Cerveza dulzona y aromática, muy refrescante y fácil de beber.

Pretty common in Hong Kong on tap and bottled, nice heavy blue bottle. Color is very pale yellowish, hazed, big white head. Aroma of lemon, radler, candies, candy orange, vanilla. Flat taste, a bit tart. Dusty, watery. Strange, excess of flavorings, seems a soft drink rather than a Wit.
Geholt in einem Match in Calais. Ein simples Witbier mit einem Nachgeschmack von Vanille und Zucker. Leider zu laff und das knackige fehlt zum Ende hin.

Bottle bought in a supermarket in Calais. Pours out in a hazy yellow-white colour with low airy head and medium body. Aroma of flowers and light wheat. Taste of mild wheat, white bread, coriander, mild citrus fruits and flowers. Flowery-sweet finish. Refreshing and drinkable, yet nothing special.

Can brewed by Carlsberg Malaysia. ABV %5. BB 27-10-2018. Poured a hazy straw yellow with a 1cm bright white dense foam head that diminished slowly to a blotchy cap that didn't lace. Carbonation low, slow and very coarse. Aroma strong of sweet peached. taste is same. Light body. Smooth with sweet peached on a short finish.   
BB 01/15. Poured a cloudy straw colour with a one- to two-finger white foamy head that retained OK and laced OK. Carbonation high and fine. Aroma of lemon plus dried fruits; weird. Taste of artificial lemon with sweet sugar; very soft drink-like. Light body. Artificially sweet and lemonade-like.

33cl bottle. Unclear yellowish color, thick white head, dense. Lemony aroma, some artificial smelling stuff pops up and destroys the aroma. Flavor has wheat, lemon, soda, fizzy, light mouthfeel. Awful aroma, flavor better. Avoid.
Full of flavour. One of the fruitiest beers I’ve tried and the spicy finish tops it off. It’ll be hard to find an easier drinking beer.

300mL bottle from Beer Run. Pours a hazy straw color with a large foamy white head. Good head retention. I guess blue glass doesn’t block the light so well as this reeks worse than the fresh dead skunk I drove over the other day. Some wheat and citrus peeks through. The taste is citrus, wheat, skunk, a bit of spice. Thin bodied, verging on watery. Meh.

(1664 Blanc) Bottle 330ml from the local Albert Heijn, poured into a tumbler. ABV 5%
Hazy body, faded honey golden colour. Small and thin white head, but with good retention. Light lacing on the glass.
Aroma of wheat, nice refreshing lemon notes, gummy bears, lime, sugar.
Taste is also quite good, although a bit artificial. Sweet, again lemon and lime, sugars, a touch of sourness but only for a moment before it becomes sweet again.
Thin body, quite carbonated, slightly dry palate.
Overall better than expected and even better than some "craft" witbiers out there. I won’t have a problem finishing this 6pack today.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and flowery smell with some citrus. I’m getting some lime or lime extract, it feels a bit artificial. Similar taste. Light body. Actually quite refreshing in this hot weather but it feels artificial.

Pours very pale straw with a fading head.
Nose shows orange lollies, lychee, super sweet-smelling. Some doughy wheat. Very confectionery-like.
Similar flavours. Fake orange, confectionery, sugar. Little else. Cloying.
Over carbonated.
Disappointing for a witbier. Quite lemony but otherwise fairly bland and one-dimensional.
Bière sans intérêt aux arômes artificiels trop prononcés. Buvable mais sans vrai plaisir, si il n’y a rien d’autre dans les environs.
Couleur jaune touble, forte mousse blanche. Nez fruité citron. Gout leger citron avec aspartame, ce dernier reste sur la langue. Fin rapide.

low-foaming and non-persistent manner. Dress is pale blond opaque. On the nose, it releases the smell of moderate to low lemon with a hint of coriander. So far so good. In the mouth, it is slightly acidic. It remains consistent with the smell of lemon. In the end, we discover aromas of medium intensity initially dominated by lemon. But everything seems a bit chemical.

Draft. My first beer in Paris 2014. Spiced white ale that poured a cloudy neon yellow color. Clean dry finish, peach juice aroma like fruit cups from the can. This really hit the spot on a hot afternoon after a lot of walking.

Pint at the shire in London
Very pale yellow 
Very tasteless ruth liked it so of course I did not
Flaska från @thaalcoholic, tack. Frisk citrusdoft, persika. Smakar citrusfriskt och svagt av belgojäst. Lite klen kropp men bara törstsläckare.

@ Havregatan. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget (15:-). Fruity and citrusy, orange, lemon, pineapple, quite sweet with light spicy notes, almost no bitterness at all. The finish is light dry, sweet and fruity. Quite fresh and nice, but not really a witbier, more of a lemonade to be honest.

It’s not the greatest white beer you’ll ever drink but as these things go its pretty decent. Basically it is to a good white beer what something like normal Kronenbourg is to a really nice lager. Perfectly drinkable.

Blue bottle from backlog notes 07. Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have pale wheat malts, lemony citrus, mild spice, watery, thin, not very interesting.

Egy nagyon átlagon aluli sör. A jellegzetes kenyér íz, ami minden sörre kell, hogy jellemz? legyen, még nyomokban sem fedezhet? fel. A küls? nem minden. Egy ilyen palackba min?ségibb italt illik tölteni.

Aroma of coriander, orange and a touch of sulphur. Hazy, pale gold colour and a foamy white cap. The flavour is unripe oranges and coriander. The body is quite light and there isn’t much of an after taste with this one. A beer to serve to guests who want to try something new, but don’t want to be challenged in any way.

Oh boy. Already losing points before I open the (blue) bottle. Label says "flavored" white beer and "caramel coloring added"...don’t add crap to your beer to color it. Let it freaking be OR, crazy thought, color it with malts. Cloudy nearly opaque dark straw hue under a bubbly/rocky white head. Smells sulphuric and leafy with wheat toast and an admittedly pleasant orange rind bite. Flavor has a bit of tangerine fruitiness and a little orange zest flavor with some light passion fruit tones with a yeasty wheaty body. Light and crisp and admittedly refreshing. Not in of itself bad, but the marketing and the sulphuric aroma cost big points.

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a big frothy white head and lots of lacing. Aroma of citrus and light spices. Taste is orange, coriander and wheat. Excellent crisp and light refreshing wit just a little too light for the style.

watery, lemon-ish, session able, citrus-y, light.
nothing special, and for sure not even close to a good wit beer.
although before you know you will finish it.

First had in the bottle a few times in June 2014, then found it on draft at Fado in 2015 and 2016. Always stood out for me as different from the average witt/white beer. Cloudy pale gold pour with a fizzy white meringue foam top. Huge milky aroma. Very lightly toasted wheat. Light lemony clementine citrus. Vanilla. Oyster crackers. Buttermilk biscuits. Medium body. The Blanc is a distinct improvement over the other Kronenbourg 1664. The newer American draft version is much juicier than the older bottles and not as solid. Rating it higher due to the good impression given me from those first bottles.
Limonada color with bubbly white head. Not so good taste. Overall a poor white beer

Clear golden coloured body with a straw white head and a slightly cloudy golden glow. Aroma of grass, light hops, yeast, wheat and a nice curacao and orange scent - not bad at all. Medium-bodied; Strong wheat and yeast flavours with some light orange flavours, straw, hay, grass, hops and a mild sweet note. Aftertaste shows some nice complexity with the malt and wheat coming through the most, but some subdued barnyardie flavours coupled with a nice yeast and hay flavour make this actually nice! Perhaps i’ve been in Asia for too long or the hot weather of Hong Kong has got to me, but this beer is actually refreshing and complex - I"m happy to be drinking it! I sampled this 50 cL can purchased a few minutes ago at 7-11 in Wan Chai on 21-June-2014 for HK$12,90 sampled here in my hotel room in Wan Chai on the Island of Hong Kong.

330 ml bottle from Systembolaget, BB 04/15 
A sweet smell of peaches, citrusy and sweet taste with distict wheat maltiness. Good and fizzy carbonated.
Has a ale yellow color. Pours off with a frothy white head which dissapears quite quick.
Overall: A nice easy drinking wit, but a bit too sweet and artifical taste for me

330ml bottle from Cellarbrations West End. Wow I was totally surprised by this as I was expecting watery fizz and I got a very flavoursome beer instead.

Bottle bought for the World Cup 2014. Go France!!! Hazy light yellow/white colour. The aroma is extremely zesty/lemon to me. Crazy how lemon lime it is. On the palate it is yeasty, more lemon zest and is easy drinking overall. Not terribly offensive. Allez les Bleus!!!
From tap. Light yellow. Smells of lime, herbs. Taste sweet. A light bitter. Det ending. Easy to drink. Enjoyable everyday now and Then.

Tap. Pours hazy yellow with thin, creamy white head. Aroma is fruity pebbles, cereal malts, light citrus, and faint floral notes. Flavor is dry malty base, light fruit sweetness, and light grassy and herb notes; dry finish. Light/medium body and medium carbonation.

Draft at Abbey Burger. Pours opaque bright yellow gold with a thin, fizzy white head. Tastes like orange, cream, wheat, very fruity. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like fruity orange citrus candy and light wheat.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Taste orange, citrus, spice. I thought this was good. I would drink this again.

A little thin, yet it tastes very good, even though it’s not especially bitter and resentful.
Orange, lemon aroma is good and the bottle shape looks like sexy when drinking in the dark place. But I dont think the taste is just like the shape and aroma.
Lovely fruity aroma and taste. Real good beer. Especially catered for Asian Palate. =)

0,33L bottle, BB 01.15. Pours hazy straw with white head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is bubblegum, sweet, citrus, and wheat. Taste is very sweet, citrus, mango, and wheat. Overall: too much carbonation, but otherwise drinkable.

Always thought this was lager-like but definitely more like a wheat beer. Really nice peach aroma gives this drop a beautiful edge. The peach carries through in taste. Few spices in there, too, like cinnamon. Maybe a bit of vanilla. Light mouthfeel. And low end finish. Great Friday night beer. Pleasantly surprised.

Damn sexy label and bottle. The contents? Meh. For it’s close proximity to Belgium, this brewery seems to have this style confused. If it is a Witbier, then I have had none other like it. If it is a Lager then it is better tasting than a lot of them. A golden yellow straw colour poured with a dissolving foamy head. Lightly floral, hay and bread with tiny citrus hops. Pretty damn refreshing.

Didn’t know this was supposed to be a Witbier, I thought it was just another lager, but from France. Since it was new and I never had anything from France, I bought it and it was what I expected. Tasted like a lager to me.
Peachy and fruity in the nose, tastes the same, somewhat enjoyable on a hot day.
Bottle. Pours turbid golden with 3-finger white head. Nose is pale malt and hopcitrus. Tastes spicy, hoppy, fruity, pale malty, with a lot of flavors dancing around. Finishes complex and quite tasty.
A great beer. If you rated it less than 3.0, you’re a whiny bitch. Lovely white.
330ml bottle. Hazy yellow body with a huge white head. Loads of lacing. Smells like citrus, herbs and cat piss. Tastes like a fruity lager with herbs and nutmeg.
330 ml bottle. A hazy light yellow beer with small white head. Strong citrus fruit aroma. Flavor is dry lemon. Nothing special.

Tastes like a lager with a fruity flavor. In a colorful bottle to get people to drink them. Has a bitter finish and I would not drink again.

Nice refreshing beer. citrus, floral, golden, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, thin feel, lively

Had on at tap at the Grog yesterday evening. $6 for the full pint. Pours a hazy effervescent orange-yellow with which a thin, whitish head 1 finger in length stood. Tastes and smells of white wine lees, coriander, Hefeweizen yeast, kalamata olive juice, and sea salt. Wheat grain, lemon seeds, and newspaper experienced at swallow. Bubbly like a champagne. Has a slightly tart-sweetness to it that I greatly appreciated. I could rink a lot of these in under an hour. Surprised I haven’t had more Witbiers lately.
Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht fruchtig, säuerlich, muffig. Geschmack leicht fruchtig, säuerlich, malzig.
Tap. Hazy pale golden with small head. Big orange flavor. Lightly sweet and smooth. i feel a little bad for liking this as much as i do.
golden, amber, orange, cloudy, sparkling, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness," umami, "medium body, creamy, slick feel, lively, long finish,

At first you see and taste a typical White beer but then you discover this beer really has his own character. A really light wheat beer with a dominant citrus and koriander taste and aroma. But a hint of peaches makes this beer surprisingly special. Really refrehing, and less boring than most other white-beers. A new favorite of mine.
Typical belgian white. Pale yellow, white head. Citrus, cardemon. Little bit too carbonated for my taste.
La même que la classique mais avec de l’arôme citron injecté dedans. Sans aucun intérêt particulier...
Déjà que la classique est affreuse il on élaboré une recette tour droit sorti de l’enfer de la bière
Bottle. Pale yellow with thin white head. Light floral, somewhat citrus aroma. Sweet taste, bit of orange.

Very good beer, light and smooth. Like French people, not like Scotland strong beer. Some people and girls who enjoy romantic may love it. My wife loves it because it tastes not bitter, and it has strong fruit and plant favor.
Light to drink beer. Problem that he doesn’t have a strong side and aftertaste reminds windshield washer fluid.

11.2 oz. bottle. Appearance: huge white head, pale straw color, clear, great lacing. Aroma: floral, cinnamon, coriander, some other spices, fruit. Palate: light body, soapy texture, average carbonation. Taste: chemical sweetness the entire time. Overall, very different, but not really in a good way. The aroma is not unpleasant, but the taste is like I imagine a dryer sheet tasting.
Uklar gul farge med hvitt skum som henger godt i glassveggen. Lukter sitron og fersken. Har en anelse ananas og sitron i smak. Lettdrikkelig med medium med kullsyre.
Bottled, clear yellow with white foam, has some lemon and berries, tastes more like a Radler than witbier
Gul med tynt hvitt skum. Aroma av sitrus, ananas og hvete, litt syrlig i smaken. Medium kullsyre, lite bitterhet. Lite eller ingen ettersmak.

Crispy and carbonated this one has a unique peach flavor that sticks on the tongue like cheap bubble gum. Tastes like some artificially added sweetner. Otherwise a witbier with bite. Not as good as Hoegaarden.

Bottle. Yellow with a small white head. Aroma has citrus and some yeast. 

Taste has orange, sour grain, some syrup. Bit too sweet, more like a mixed drink or a radler. Very smooth still and no extra yeast flavor.
Pours a hazy straw yellow. Smells of oranges with some floral. Light, sweet taste of oranges
Fräsch smak av citrus, ingen beska, passar bra till kyckling. Ganska söt, kan jämföras med cider.

Surprisingly I was really stoked about how this tasted. Maybe it’s because I’m in Cambodia surrounded by piss lager, but this being French was actually not bad. Like a watered down Hoegaarden, but okay!
Aroma :very sweet coriander aroma that dominates Taste: apricot aromas prevalent not much else to noteAroma : cloudy light gold body with nice retention

Drank from the can. Aroma of oranges and wheat and fake man made citrus fruits. Taste is much the same but watered down. Better than a crap lager, but not by much. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Light to moderate grain for the malt, moderate to heavy lemon/orange and perfume for the hops, with clove and other faint tropical fruit. Head is average size, frothy/creamy, white, with good lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is murky yellow. Flavor starts lightly to moderately sweet and slightly acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and slightly acidic. Palate is light to medium, slightly creamy, with a lively carbonation. Better than I expected after seeing the other ratings, though a little too artificially sweet, but it’s still a pretty tasty Wiybier.

330ml deep, dark blue bottle. Kindly shared by djoeye. Bubbly white head. Golden body with a wheat haze. Rings of lace. Sweet lemon on the nose, rather dry. Taste character with sweet lemon to the fore, some spices beneath. Way too sweet, soft drink impression (Tromsø 17.01.2014).

OnTap; white good head, yellow hazy bright lemonish body, various blankets inside the tall proper cooled glassware.  Aroma of wheat, sweet malts, citrus, mostly lemons, some mandarine.  Tastes wheat, lemon and mandarine, crystal sugar, sweet almond.  Feels as a limonade almost. Finishes quite shortly, fruits and pears, leavess, flour. Fresh. Better than bottled, but if one cooles a bottle well and pours it into well cooled glassware, it might be a fresh clean experience.
[50cl@O’Learys Tromsø 2015-apr-14] - - - 
Bottle; Tall pearl white head, hazy bright golden body, lacings ok.
Wheat malt in scents, also corander, hints from lemon.
Wheat malt in taste, also very much lemon juice, very few hints of coriander.
Too juicy to palate, feels as soft drink. Ends with wheat malt and white bread.
Overall the better qualities drowned in the lemon juice. May the recipe be adjusted a bit.
Enjoyed@BalticRateMeet with Rune 2014-jan-17 [33cl green bottle b@Systembolaget Storheden Luleå Sweden.]

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy straw with a large white head. Aroma is citrus, coriander, sweet bubblegum. Taste is sweet ,slightly artifical, citrus, light bitter. Light bitter citrus finish. Light body.

29/XII/13 - on tap @ Strandpaviljoen BaZ (Breskens) - BB: n/a (2013-1191) 


Clear straw yellow beer, creamy white head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: lots of grains, sweet, bit sugary, malty touch, bit of a chemical smell. MF: soft carbon, light to medium body. Taste: lots of orange peel, pretty sugary, sweet, some citrus, very watery. Aftertaste: little sour, grains, bit sugary, some orange peel. Complete lack of coriander, way too sweet, an insult to my country and it’s beers! :p
Couleur jaune avec un col moyen blanc. nez de céréales et d’agrumes. En bouche mélanges de céréales d’agrumes et d’épices. Trop sucré et mal balancé, pas tellement bon!
Bottle @ home. Aroma is spices, citrus, faint malt. Flavour is dry fruity, fake citrus mostly, some wheat and malt. A bit too artificial imho.
Cloudy yellow. Aroma is yeasty and citrus. Slight Skunky aspect to it. Tastes as if made with adjunct ingredients. Possibly some corn. Funky aftertaste as well. Wouldn’t reach for this again.
Importé au Québec, CA. Bu en canette. Quatrième ingrédient est un succédané de sucre !!!!!!

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. blue bottle poured into a glass. Pours hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is nice orange, medium/light body, medium carbonation, and some lacing. Taste is light simple orange.

Ljusgul grumlig vätska med fint vitt skum som lämnar rester när det sjunker ihop. Doften är frisk och fruktig med vissa citrustoner. Smaken är väldigt fruktig. Är det lätt kolsyrad saft jag dricker? Detta är väldigt långt ifrån vad jag uppskattar hos en öl. Söt saftaktig smak. liten kolsyra och noll beska, men ändå uppfattar jag den som intressant. Men god? Nej knappast.

Bottle. Hazy straw-yellow pour with a decent fizzy head. Very fruity, light citrus aroma, nice but a little slinky. Very light citrus flavour, mostly lemon, a little orange and peach. Mostly sweet and light with a little bitterness. Overall too thin, light and flavourless, but not repulsive.
This would be a great summer beer. Lemony citrus. Very light and easy drinking.

Ein französisches Witbier mit Orangenschalen, Koriander und jede Menge Aromastoffen und Zucker. Sehr sortentypisch hellgelb, frisch-zitroniger Geruch. Der Antrunk ist auch sortentypisch frisch und angenehm zitronig säuerlich. Im Hauptteil kommen angenehme Gewürzaromen zu einem vollen und leicht hefigen Weißbierkörper dazu, eine ganz leichte Herbe ist wahrnehmbar. Der Nachgeschmack ist mittellang, leicht herb-zitronig und frisch. Trotzdem ist das Bier ein Bisschen zu süß und schmeckt ganz leicht künstlich. 

--> Für eine französische Witbier-Imitation recht trinkbar, insgesamt aber nur im Mittelfeld anzusiedeln, da etwas zu süß!



Test vom 22.1.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,10,12,9,12,9 - 10,05

Pours a pale yellow colour with a big creamy head. Smell of peach, dough and grass. Flavour is much the same. Quite fresh taste. Mellow mouthfeel and a tad watery maybe. Not a challenging beer, but it suited me just fine in the heat of Singapore.
Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of wheat, some yeast, and citrus, citrus, citrus, citrus... Taste is sweet lemony citrus tones. A bit too candy-fruity for my taste.

Pouring from a bottle into glass, the color is blond. The head is adequate but flattens immediately. It’s nowhere near as lively as its lager brother. Tastes citrus with some bitterness. To sum it up, this beer is way too shandy-like for me.
Bu en bouteille de 25cl, je cherche toujours l’intérêt de cette fausse blanche car hormis un rajout de fleurs d’oranger je comprends pas ce machin... dégueulasse
bouteille de 33cl - très fruitée du genre orange/citron. Gout de médicament: trop sucré pour cacher ce qui est amer. pas pétillant. Je me crois chez des vieux et je ne peux m’en aller. archinul.

Tried on tap in Hungary. A simple white beer with lemony tastes. Refreshing and easily drinkable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nydelig øl med Sitrus, pasjonsfrukt
, floral, vanilje, korn, karamell. Sterkt anbefalt
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow, fluffy white head, small amounts of lace. Nose is fruity, almost grape like. Quite refreshing.

On tap at Colonel Mustard, august 5th 2013. Cloudy yellow, medium white head. Aroma of grain, bubblegum, hints of spice. Taste is thin and weak of wheat and citrus, too sweet, and nt very pleasant. Why serve poor beers like this at a pub running good beers previously? Guess corporate money still decides at some places :/
Pretty freaking awesome wit. Thinner and more watery, sure, but yeasty, a bit softer (cheaper) on the esters perhaps but still delicious. one of the best macro Wits ever

330 mL bottle. Light, cloudy yellow color, with a huge, frothy, off-white head. The aroma is lemon juice, coriander, and wheat. The flavor is light citrusy sweetness, and very slightly tart. The aftertaste is a little sour and medicinal. Light body, creamy and very smooth drinking. This is a pretty good witbier. Refreshing and crisp.
Bottle - Wheat and honey. Hazy yellow with a thin head. Lemony sweetness and a bit of wheat. Refreshing bit a bit sweet.
Pours hazy yellow, brief head no lace. Aromatic in general, but nothing specific. Some citrus and flowers. Coriander in the taste. Malty finish. A summer beer, unpretentious.
Very light in color. Soft on the palate, hint of citrus and orange peal. Great for mass consumption..

Bottle from super-market. They lied when they said it had a hint of citrus as the citrus is quite over-powering when you first smell it. Less so when dirnking it, which is nice. The citrus really adds depth and character to the flavour of the beer. Recommended

Looks fine for the style, hazy and pale. Unique aromas. Very fruity with some graininess. The fruit works in the aroma but not so much in the flavor. Comes off as bubblegum or candy. Some tanginess characteristic of the style, but not enough to offset the weird fruity sweetness. Has an underlying cheap beer flavor and smell. You know what I mean, but I am not sure what gives it that. 50 cl can from a Hong Kong 7/11 poured into a tumbler.

Whitish yellow cloudy body, small white short-lived head. Sweet, quite strong and a bit artificial aroma with sugary lemonade and tutti frutti, Not that refreshing. Flavours follow the aroma. Somewhat dry finish. 

[40 cl from tap, @O’Reilly’s, Oslo]
Fresh&fruity taste, opaque&light in colour with low-medium carbonation. Great refreshing beer for the summer.
Cloudy yellow pour with a whitehead. Aroma is orange, tropical fruit. Taste is the same, nice wheat backbone. So-so lacing. Cool blue bottle.
Lemon, peach aroma. Peach juice flavor, wheat, pepper, creamy finish. Tastes like an awkward peach perfume, may be less harmful on the skin rather than in the mouth :)

...was very easy drinking, light body, but not thin tasting. Hazy light yellow color, small white head. Had a nose of some spice, with some light spice notes. Had a peach-like flavor in the finish, was pretty sweet. Better than I expected.

This is the first white beer that I got to like. Nice pale gold and cloudy, as a bladder infection. OK, the metaphor was negative, but the beer looks pretty good. Great aroma of berries, more of a bubblegum type, the artificial cherry or raspeberry. The old Tutti Frutti. None of that sweaty arse nose of the Belgian Whites...Same for the flavour, that is pure cherry bubblegum. A bit sour perhaps some citrus, definitely pleasant and easy to drink. And the presentation is superb. I really liked it.

Couleur paille avec une imposante couche de mousse, elle est trouble mais semble mince. Au nez, fruits très sucrés : mandarines, citron, fraises. Très sucrée et fruitée en bouche, florale également, elle est presque agressive, manquant de subtilité, et perdant de son côté désaltérant. Un peu de retenue l’aurait aidé à se démarquer peut-être, car les saveurs sont assez originales, quoique sonnant un peu faux. Correcte, sans plus.
Candy like Belgian White. Pez/ Fruit Loops like quality. Thin with sticky finish.
0.33L bottle. Cherry bubblegum aroma. Nice fat white hat on top. Real lemon an lime juice taste. Light grain and yeast flavors. Drinkable.

It is a nice beer that you should try once. Buy it is not ine of my favorite beers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Un couleur jaune-blanc avec un col moyenne blanc. L’arôme de blé, et les épices comme du coriandre. Le goût est de blé avec du coriandre. Rafraîchissante et facile à boire.

Yellow with white head, some residuum on the bottom. Aroma of some grapefruit, floral, unusually exotic, and coriander. Taste is medium sweet, fruity, grain almost disappears due to the added orange and lemon peels and coriander. A bit more grain aroma would be nice.

Flaska från SB. Fruktig, frisk doft med drag av artificiella smaktillsatser som drar åt persikaschampoo. I smaken finns ännu mer tvåliga läsksmaker som inte alls är trevliga. Liten limeskalsbeska räddar något men nej, undvik helst.

Svært frisk øl.    
Gul uklar på utseenede. Lukter appelsin og sitron. Sitrus også i smaken, nesten som mandarin. Lite bitterhet, kort ettersmak også sitrus.

Actually pretty good. Much better than the 1664 pale lager. Nice and fruity and refreshing aroma. Quite yellow colour, and the aroma says yellow fruits too. Refreshing, exciting, partley sweet, some lack of bitterness, perfectly acidic. Perfect summer beer?
Bière fraîche et fruitée faite pour une après-midi près de la piscine. Goût d?agrume de blanche commerciale, mais pas trop persistant.

500ml@Henrik 22.06.13. Thanks Dan! Hazy yellow body with tiny white head. Apricot, peach, pineapple, coriander and citrus. Actually very refreshing on a damp summer evening, and what I would call a pleasant surprise. It instantly became Inger’s favourite and she made quite the effort the following week looking for and eventually ordering a number of bottles to keep herself hydrated through the summer:-)

11.2oz blue glass bottle. Totally hazy whitish yellow color. Thin white ehad. Few loose bits of lace. Aroma is pretty lemony, and spice, which on it’s own isn’t too bad, but lacks the other half of what makes a good wit, a good yeast profile. Yeast here contributes nothing, it’s all lemon citrus and spice. Body is also a bit thin. Light body, lighter, kind of crisp carbonation. More sweet taste. Lightly zesty. OK, but not really my kind of wit. Very lemony. Seems to compete more with Summer Shandy than a real craft white. Bit of a macroish, lagery-type feel to the finish as well, but not too bad overall.

Bought in a supermarket in Kazakhstan. A Carlsberg Kazakhstan beer. I had high hopes for this but was let down. It was my first white beer of my taste testing and it may turn out that I won’t like the taste of white beers in general. It had a clear citrus taste but I thought the taste of it was rather sickly. I appreciate that the taste is completely different to the standard variety of beers produced by Carlsberg Kazakhstan but still despite that I failed to enjoy this beer at all. Also it should be noted that the Kazakh version of this has an ABV of 4.5%

[bottle]
Fruity citrus orange and lemon aroma with a bit of a lactic twang. Hazy dark yellow under a lasting, thin, white cover that laces the glass. Sweet lemon-lime soda with some sweet malt and a faint coriander accent. Balance is a bit too far on the sweet side to make this refreshing--especially as the beer warms. Moderate-medium carbonation, smooth, lime finish.
Pale blond and hazy appearance. Aroma has some caramelised orange. Orange also comes through in the flavour which is overall too sweet with an almost sacharrin-like aftertaste.
Sub par beer. The body is the best thing about it the aroma is weak the taste is wheat and fruit with a lot of effervescent finish
At a rooftop bar in Montreal. Too sweet. Cloudy. Yellow. Very much like lemonade.
Bottle. Gold, slightly hazy, decent head. Taste is slightly lemon, unusual, pleasant taste. Aroma was slight skunk with a slight fruity smell.
Bottle. Hazy yellow color with a foamy white head. Aroma of corriander, wheat and lemon. A bit skunky, slightly sour taste. Medium thin body.

Bottle, bought @ Intermarche, Lannion. Pours murky pale green-yellow with a medium, staying, creamy, white head. Aroma has artificial citrus, wheat sweetness. Medium carbonation, thin and watery mouthfeel. Flavour has wheat, mild citrus, light artificial.
Flaske fra systembolaget. Lys gylden,ugjennomsiktig .lavt karbonert.lite skum. Mye gjær.smaker aprikos og fersken

Really cool blue bottle, nice. Smell is light euro. Nice pour with a foamy head, goes rocky. Taste a mild artificial lemon. Sizzly. Aroma goes somewhat metallic. Volatile and mildy tickling the olfactory with a hint of fuming alcky. Quite unique, wew. Not sure what to think about this cutting beer. Nifty knooling nestering nuts. Giving this beer a 5 for taste is pressing it.

Yeasty citrus aroma, like Pez candy almost. Yellow color, slight haze. Sweet, spunky yeast and lemon zest flavor, almost tart in an artificial way. Light beer with zest but no body heft. Halfway to a shandy.
2013 - 07 - 08 500ml can bought on holiday in France. hazy light yellow colour. medium, fading to small, white head. banana and citrus in aroma. light sweet taste.
0,5l can from Casino Géant Poitiers. Pours hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma is malts, wheat and citrus. Flavor is malts, wheat, some citrus and a hint of coriander. Not too bad.

On tap @ Penny Lane, Sønderborg. Pours cloudy golden with small white head. Clear aroma of yeast, grain and hops with a touch of citrus. Sweetish, grainy and yeasty flavour with notes of banana and citrus fruit. Slightly sourish aftertaste. OK but nothing really special.

Bottle. Pours a murky blonde with chunks of yeast floating around and a big white head that’s quite stable. Aroma is fruity, lemon and slight yeasty. Flavour is quite sweet and fruity again. Decent wit, beter than I’d expected

This pours a hazy, lemonade color with a foamy, white head. The aroma is mild with hints of wheat, citrus, and spices. It’s quite thin in texture yet has an ok flavor of wheat and citrus. It’s light and refreshing but not anything all that special.

330ml bottle. Cloudy golden beer with a bubbly, white foam. Euro lager meets belgian wit. Hmm. Aroma is fairly potent, citrus (orange) and coriander. Mouthfeel is high carbonation, no alcohol notes or warmth on the palate. Taste is pleasant at first, hint of citrus and yeasty kick, but still very bubbly and plain. Decent.

Overall: Weak
Note: On-tap at Maximus Steakhouse Reviewed 2013-06-28.

Not bad. Spicey and fruity white. Cloudy yellow pour. 

You can do a lot worse. 





---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at KL. Sweet variant of the belgian white. Aromas of coriander, bublegum. Taste is sweet, with average length, no sourness. Palate is oily, and medium bodied. Pale, with a very frothy head.

I knew this was probably going to be bad before I even opened the bottle but I’m a sucker for trying new beers. Hazy yellow pour with minimal white head. Skunky grass aromas. Flavor is weak with what little there is being unpleasant skunky notes mixed with a funky zing. I drank it as fast as I could just to get it over with.
330 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Hazy bright yellow, white head. Aroma has pale malt, wheat, fruity notes and some chemical notes. Taste: peach, wheat, yeast. Thin and not very pleasant.
Bottle. Pale yellow, rich foamy head. Nice nose of citrus, spice and faint hops. Thinnish mouthfeel, decent carbonation. Pretty sour, but fresh and tasty out of the bottle.

Completely cloudy yellow. White head lasts forever. Very floral aroma and fruity and floral taste. A real blanc. This beer I must say is quite impressive for what it is. It always looks good, tastes good, and that head lasts forever... and it smells good. The finishes is ever so slightly dry. Purely refreshing. Rating based on style.

Old rating rerated 25.01.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:

Small creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, peach, citrus, yeast, light malts, canned tropical fruits. Taste is fruity and slightly grainy, wheat, canned tropical fruits, peach, citrus, yeast, hay, dough. Little bitterness, grainy fruity mouthfeel. For being what it is, it’s actually nice and easy drinking.
The most delicious beer I’ve ever had! Slightly fruity, very refreshing! Wish they sold it near whereIi live :(

Aromen inleder med en fruktig ton i allmänhet och persika i synnerhet med svaga inslag av något kemikaliskt. I smaken så är det tonen av persika som är dominant med ett svagt inslag av jäst, och det kemikaliska kan jag inte alls känna av. Dessvärre är kroppen väldigt tunn och speciellt balanserad vill jag inte heller kalla den.
Pours hazy pale yellow into a tumbler. Tropical fruit and orange aromas. Dry with mango and orange front to back and into the abrupt finish.
330ml bottle. Slightly hazy yellow color. Small, thick white head, stays. Sweet, apple jam, bready aroma. Sickly sweet, apples, malty flavor. Coca cola of beers. Not again.

Small blue bottle. Cloudy straw yellow body with a medium head. Lots of sweet lemon in aroma. Taste has peach bubblegum and sweet lemon candies. No perceivable hints of coriander that you’d expect to find in a witbier. Almost like shampoo in some ways. Very sweet and fruity witbier but the body is too watery. Would have again.

Couleur de miel, voilée. Mousse correcte. Nez fruité et sucré, avec des traces de limonade sucrée, de jus d’orange. En bouche, c’est frais et fruité. Le goût de la blanche et du blé, et de la levure, est tassé pas les flaveurs sucrées de jus d’agrumes (mangues, oranges) ; très rafraîchissant, certes. Mais je crois bien que je me tannerais à la longue, car c’est un tantinet trop sucré... Cheers!

First of all, bonus appearance point for the snazzy blue bottle. Cloudy yellow, thin white head. Smells like blueberry and banana, with some subtle spicy notes. Flavor is fruity, with decent spicy and some soft wheat character. I was surprised how much I enjoyed this.
