On tap at Pub Italia.  Pours a full, glowing canary yellow with medium white head. Delightful aroma of lemon and perfume. Slight floral potpourri presence. Flavor has a flowery, soft perfume presence with orange peel and wheat. Full wheat body with cheerios and perfume finish. I don’t care that this is mass produced... I thought this was great! Great springtime beer.
February 2013. Sampled at a tasting. Clove, malt and yeast aromas. Poured pale yellow with a white head. Banana, hay and orange zest flavors. Not bad for a mass produced beer.
eh, not bad but still kinda watery and weak. a pretty bland wit if ever there was one. not a repeat drinker.
Good beer, expected it to crystal clear in colour when I poured it into a pint. Good beer nonetheless!

Artificial, artificial, artificial! Everything about this beer feels fake, fake lemon and wheat on the nose. Fake lemon tartness and flavors. It is not bad per se, just not targeted at a Ratebeer kind of audience. It is better than most macrobrews in a sense, which is good. There is some kind of head and some lacing, good. But all the artificial flavors make it a "once in the summer" kind of deal (at social events where there is no real beers being served of course). It’s really quaffable and refreshing, just not complex or something I would crave.
Very interesting complex brew. Light with a hazy yellow color. Foamy head and a zest of lemon and other tropical fruits with a wheat brew taste as well. Worth a try in the summer months.

500 ml on tap @ Palace Bar,Oslo.April 13,2013
Served in a Kroenbourg glass
Cloudy and yellowish in color
Aroma is all sorts of citrus and some yeast
Very sweet in taste and little else.
Difficult to take this beer serious and it reminds me of alcopops.
Tycker detta är en utmärkt sommar öl. Lagom söt med toner av belgisk jäst, citrus-, apelsin-, persika och koriander smaker. Frisk och syrlig.
i had my girlfriend we got drunk she stayed streight but i turned gay in the morning when i woke up !! wtf is this gaydrink

Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a nice small bead head that is small but coats the glass throughout.  Aroma is corn tortilla, right out of the package with nothing on it.  Taste is sweet pale malt, yeast, bread dough and lust a hint of lemon.  This is an excellent wit.  I wish other raters would rate by style rather than compared to other beer styles they like.

SMOOTH//PEACH//FRESH//CARB//
if your into fruity beers this one is a pretty decent one the peach or citrisy flavour to it allowed me to polish off more than six but you pay for it the next day a good beer to drink tubing down the river under a burning sun
Blue bottle: Peach, papaya, and coriander nose. Milky golden, thick sticky head.Very peachy flavor. Rather flat, medium body. Flavorful, unique, but seems artificial.

On tap @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a hazy straw yellow body with a medium white head. Nose is well-rounded citrus and coriander notes, with sweet pale malts and hints of wheat in the back. Taste is lemony citrus tones, carrot juice, coriander, sweet malts and hints of straw and grass in the back. Medium to light body, medium to high carbonation. Fair enough, but a bit fruit juice-like and a bit sweet.

Bottle @ home picked up at Wilbur’s Fort Collins. Pours a hazy yellow appearance with a creamy, white head. Pineapple, tropical fruity, zesty lemon aroma. Soft mouth feel. Passion fruit, pineapple, mango, slightly spicy flavor that really is just a one-dimensional fruit bomb.
0.5 l bottle. colour of bottle are great. but most of all i was surprised by his fruty taste. citrus , grapefruit, orange all ir one are mixed with beer.

Frisk tøseøl, smagen ikke af meget. Men fik flasken gratis så den kører ned. Smager frisk blomster agtig god sammen med sushi

Free Føroyar!!!

On tap at Henrik, Bergen. Pours a light dull yellow colour with a creamy white medium head. Lots of citrus in the aroma and almost like lemon soda. I also find wheat and some sweet Belgian Yeast. The flavour is sweet as well with more lemon candy, and hay and wheat in the end. Has a slick mouthfeel and no bitterness. This is an easy drinking and fresh beer, but is too sweet in my opinion.

Flaske på Kastrup: "avec une pointe d’agrumes" - med litt sitrus. Lukter parfymert og smaker som alkopop. Blåfargen og flaskedesign understreker parfymeimaget. Helst gyselig, bra at jeg kunne betale med en voucher.

Fruity, citrusy, lemon, orange, bit thin, but quite enjoyable, Apples and pears. 
Ap: hazy golden colour, medium White head. 
F: flowery, artificial additives, like candy, citrusy, bit thin and watery. 
M: bit thin. 
T: Goes down easy enough, too easy to be frank.
Apricot aromas.  Apricot and spice flavors. Finishes a little quick. Overall a decent wit.

On tap @ Henrik. This is a cloudy straw golden one - looks like well used dishwasher water this and it has a small creamy off-white top. The nose is not nice at all. Smells of old lemons, grains, refrigeration water and it’s just unpleasant. It has a soft oily mouthfeel and a sprinkling average carbonation level. The taste has more old citric tones, wheat, some hay/grassy thing. Not mine thang. 08.12.2012
Pours a cloudy light yellowish white with a thick white head. Aroma is light cloves and estery. flavour is very light banana clove herbs would be great for a nice hot summer day
Aroma är rätt intressant. Fruktig och känner en hint av gummi. Typ kondom?! Smaken, sur och allmänt jävlig.

Bouteille de 341ml, robe blanche opaque, arôme d'agrumes, goût artificiel des agrumes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy golden colour; Small head and foam which fades in less than 1 minute; Light body, so-so lacing with weak to minimal carbonation; Strong and persisting aroma of grapefruit, peach and lemon; Taste is mild in line with Belgian white / witbier, muted sweetness with orange, trace of coriander, and a bubbly citric tartness finish. No hop bitterness. Slightly dry after taste.



Comments: compares to Hoegaarden, this one has a stronger aroma and taste; on the minus side, the appearance is disappointing, citrus aroma seems artificial, head and carbonation is very weak, and a watery body. Even though I am not a fan of Hoegaarden, this one is in no way to overtake the “standard”. If I really want something mindlessly strong, well this is it. Then again, this is not what witbier is about, right?
Fruity, orange flavour over the usual Kronenbourg 1664. Pours a misty beige, with a fruity beer aroma.

Aroma has orange, touch of lemon, some mandarin notes, and even maybe a touch of apricot and peach. Appearance is a nice opaque yellow colour with a light large-bubbled white head. Taste is nice peach and orange peel notes, peach dominates, touch of apricot and lemon. Palate has a nice effervescence and touch of tartness and bitterness around mouth, on cheeks in particular. Overall, surprisingly good blanche for 1664.

330ml bottle. Minimally cloudy pale golden colour with average to huge, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Fruity aroma has an intense, minimally artificial, peach note. Taste is initially moderately sweet fruity with a peach note, later with a citrusy sherbet touch - slightly artificial throughout; a bit flat and watery overall.

really attractive appearance with typical belgian white beer colour and correct head; sourish aroma - so far, it is ok, but the taste ruins the perfect experience; in fact it is quite bad...I would not call it as belgian whitebeer; it has some artificial sourish lemonade taste with some annoying sweetener taste.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a light yellow color ale. Medium white foamy head that leaves a minimal lacing. Aroma of light wheat malt. Taste is dominated by lightly sweet malt, watery with hint of coriander and orange peel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hazy yellow colour, huge head. Strong aroma of lemons and dishwater. Taste is artificial orange. Feels like a mix between a pale lager and a wit.
Bottle. Pours very pale yellow, quite cloudy, 1-finger white head, great lacing. Nose is lemon, wheat, candy. Very simple. Flavours of spritzy lemon, fresh orange, very thin. Boring.
On tap somewhere in Paris. Golden hazy color. Thin to medium head. Low sweetness. Too much citrus in aroma. Yet some wheat and coriander.
5.0% (it was in blue bottles when I bought it in France), hazy pale gold colour with a thin head, fruity aroma, fairly sweet citrus taste, Dot likes it more than me but I will not turn one down.

Bonne bière au goût léger. Arôme d’agrumes prononcés. Si vous aimez les "Coolers" on perçoit a peine le goût de bière.

À boire l’été ou peut-être avant ou après un repas (apéro ou digestif) ou simplement quand vous n’avec pas le goût que quelque chose de pesant et charnu.
Great fruit taste for a beer.  Very refreshing and must be ice cold.  Leaves a coriander taste but you just ask for another sip

Initial aroma of stale lager and orange peel. Hazy cloudy pale straw with a thin persistent head no lacing. The corriander / orange flavour is overpowering. one -dimensional limited depth but quite drinkable.

Floral corriander to the nose.  Hint of orange zest flavor with light hints of wheat malt in the foreground.  A bit of a fruity aftertaste.  Light crisp mouthfeel.  bubbly white head and pale yellow body.
0.33l bottle. Pale golden body, white head. Aroma of lemon peel with some spicyness. Orangish  taste with a little hop bitterness, watery mouthfeel. Nothing bad about it, but nothing extra.
Pours a clear straw yellow with a slight orange tinge.  Aroma is orange, wheat and grass.   Taste is orange, corriander, wheat and grassy grains.
A hazy golden orange with no real head. Aroma of a lemon cleaner. Tastes like a shandy, real heavy on the lemon, no yeast, little spice, no wheat, pretty lame witbier.

Pours hazy light cream color.
Smells apricot, citrus and blossom.
Mouth is very fruityquite acid but refreshing. A
romatically basic with orange peel notes but too artificial and short.
On tap and in bottle. Good beer. Really drinkable. Taste more like peach instead of orange and lemon. Interesting. I recommend

330ml blue bottle. Pale yellow pour, hazy. Good sized creamy white cap. Orange and lemon in the nose, wheat and spice. Light citrusy taste, some peels, creamy wheat malt. Very light in body and mouthfeel. Light fruity aftertaste. Ok, works well in the summer heat.
On tap in Amsterdam. Citrus body w big puffy head. Nose is plenty citrus and hops. Taste is floral, citrus, rice and dry. Creamy texture. Quite okay.

Draft.  Pours cloudy yellow with a white head.  Aroma of artificial lemon.  Flavour is medium sweet, low bitter.  A bit chemical like and artificial, not good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

25cl at a music festival.
Thin white head.  Hazy blond pour. Not bad.  Much better than their pils.
Tastes like soap :(  - I drink a lot of beers and am not very picky but this is yukki......I won’t buy it again. Kronenbourg marketers should tell their people not to sell this one anymore.

Bottle in Beach Bar, Nyon. This is a very curious beer. Comes in a very small blue bottle and was served with a lemon. It’s basically a violation of the blanche style, with a load of chemicals loaded into a bottle to make it taste like a mass market palatable version of Hoegaarden. I’d think of it as an alcoholic soft drink or a shandy rather than a beer, and if you start from that base it actually (and perhaps sadly) tastes ok, especially on a hot day in the sun. Cloudy yellow, not so much wheat character or yeast, peachy lemony sweetness, bit of spice, virtually no aftertaste.

A Blanc-ban a címke súgása szerint egy huncut szem árpa sincsen, szemben a búzasörök elsöprő többségével. Valószínűleg épp ennek köszönheti szélsőségesen egyéni ízét (és színét), ami a maga zománcszaggatóan citromos, mégis összeálló és kellemes összhatásával egészen kivételes élménnyé teszi sörünket, elsősorban kuriozitás, másodsorban ízélmény szempontjából. Megjelenése alapján meg garantáltan sokkal stílusosabban és egyénibben lehet egy, az üveg mellé tett, félig töltött pohárral sörivósat játszani társaságban, mint mondjuk Heinekennel vagy Borosdival. Az Adria Sétányon folyamatosan kapható!

Bottle: Poured a light yellow color ale with a medium size pure white foamy head with OK retention and minimal lacing. Aroma of light wheat malt is pretty thin. Taste is dominated by lightly sweet wheat malt notes with no spices or other characteristics. Body is bit thin with OK carbonation. Watery version of the style with limited amount of coriander or orange peel makes this an unattractive beer.
One of my favorite beers. Crisp citrus flavor may turn some more hardcore enthusiasts off, but when from the tap with a slice of orange, there aren’t many beers that compare on a hot day.

On tap at joeys. Bright, hazy yellow. Nice airy cap. Stickin to the glass alright. Smells a bit stuffy/skunky. Slight lemon smell. Taste is diluted lemon, but closer to diluted lemon soap suds. Is this refreshing? I don't know. It's wet. Doesn't leave much to appreciate.
Tangy and fresh. Distinctive citrus aroma. Unfiltered and pale yellow in color with very small foam crown.

33cl bottle @ home shared with Dutchdebus. Hazy very pale yellow color, small to medium sized white head that lasts for quite a while. Smell lightly malts, fruits like apple and lightly peach, apricot. Taste fruityness, light to medium sweetness, apricot, lightly apple, lightly peach. Low body, low carbo.

Bottle thx to benzai. Very pale hazy yellow colour with a big cloudy white head. Smells fruity (apple, peach).. This smell surprised me in a positive way. Tastes apple and fresh. Nice one! Low carbo, thin body.

First beer of my French tasting evening, a white 500ml bottle best before 31st May 2008, drank in Oct 2007.

Poured into a Hoegaarden Grand Cru glass.

Very pale and cloudy, a weak yellow lemon colour, a sort of thin Hoegaarden Witbier appearance, with next to no head.

Citrus fruits allover the place in the aroma, lemons and grapefruit mostly.

Although the beer looked a little weak it did have some umph and I thought it was OK, the taste was a sour fruity-cum-lemony-spicey mix which would have been ideal on a hot summers day.

The flavours did stay and nothing nasty turned up like they often can in Witbiers. Again although it looked wishy-washy it was OK.

Nothing wrong with this beer, it was a lot better than I thought it would be.

Doesn’t smell bad necessarily, almost an aroma of peach with the wheat. The look is cloudy, and about proper for the style but the taste really brings it down. The peachiness remains but sours quickly, balls up in the back of your throat. Bottle.

Draft at Budapest restaurant Menza. Unfiltered, bright hazy yellow with foamy white head. Perfumy, slight lemongrass. Slight fruity, alc-perfume body. very odd. not such a fan, very flowery. but drinkable.
Pretty fancy bottle. Very fruity beer.....peach dominant but blends well with the natural beer flavour. Would be nice on a hot summer day.

Golden yellow with thick foam head. Very fruity, peach, but not too sweet. Nice aftertaste. (Ufa 201204)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle.   Poured straw coloured, a bit hazy, with a thin white head. Aroma of candied lemon drops. Carbonated mouthfeel, light body. Wheat based flavour, notes of lemon, bubblegum, a hint of spice. Refreshing.
Not much here. Some fruit on the nose and on the palate. Otherwise fairly bland. Something I would chug on a hot summer day....very easy to drink.
Bottle. Pours a yellow colour with a medium size white head, plenty of fruit and some spice in the aroma, the taste is all tropical fruit with a dry finish.
330ml bottle form the LCBO. hazed light yellow, lasting white head. pretty average wit. fruitier then most. nice for a macro.
Looks like witbier. Little foam.Really no aroma or smell and very little aftertaste. Fruity taste, hint of strawberry. Best for hot summerdays.

0.33 l bottle from Systembolaget in Strømstad, Sweden. Hazy withe and light light yellow colour with a foamy white head. Smells a lot of citrus. The taste is a lot more fruity than a normal belgian wit bier. Fuzzy carbonation.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy pale straw colured with a big creamy white head. The aroma fights it way immediately after the bottle opens, strong coriander and yeast with citrussy notes. Taste is citrus and yeast, fresh lemonade with a moderate dry end. Quite good, probably much better a hot summer day.
grass, cereal, cooked vegetables, banana, vanilla, pale, clear, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, creamy, average carbonation,

Sorry for the german rating, but this is a lousy rating from my "newbie" time (2007-2009), and it’s not worth of being translated. I just added it for the statistics, and to complete my backlog!


Im Glas ist das Bier Zitrusgelb, leicht trüb. Die Krone ist feinporig, flach und dezent lange haltbar. Der Geruch ist hefig fruchtig. Der Antrunk ist merkwürdig fruchtig. Ich schmecke Pampelmuse. Es ist fruchtig, aber wirklich kaum süß. Ein leichtes Zitrusaroma zeigt sich nach 3-4 Schlücken. Der beinhaltete Koriander kommt im Nachgeschmack sehr langgezogen und intensiv durch. Ein merkwürdiges, aber dennoch sehr interessantes Bier!

330 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours hazy yellow with a huge frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of trace and lacing on the glass. Smell is perfume-like with apricot jam, pears in sugar syrup and wheat flour. Smell is very artificial and quite nasty. Taste is stale and artificially sweet with apricots and wheat. Finish is sweet and fruity and lasts way longer than I has hoped for. Could stomach 2 mouthfuls, the rest went down the drain.
Decent beer, way much better than the regular Kronenbourg and 1664. Good flavour, a bit too sparkling

33cl bottle. Very nice beer, it taste is quite citrus with some ananas. hop and yeast feeling can discover only in the end of a gulp. It is a light, thin body but always foamy beer. I liked it, just a bit pricy. Viva France!
Nothing similar to ordinary Kronenbourg, but on its own a fantastic wheat beer with fruit tastes being released.

Had this one on tap, and I’ll be honest on a hot summer day, this little guy is quite refreshing.  Citrus & coriander on the nose, hazy yellow in colour. Crisp and clean.  If I had to drink a macro-produced beer and be content about it, this would be a candidate.

strong citrus and yeast aroma.  pours a fairly thick white head.  intense citrus (orange, lemon and apricot) flavours hit early.   Unfortunately, this tastes very artificial.  Overly fizzy mouthfeel.  finish is quite smooth with some lemon.  Overall, not bad, but no one will mistake this macro attempt at a wit for anything other than just that (a macro attempt).
Very decent wheat beer with orange flavor and strong coriander after-taste.   Probably the best macro-produced white I’ve had.
On tap.  Pours very light blone and slightly hazy with slight frothy bright white head.  Slight fruity aroma.  Drinks very smooth.

330ml bottle pours a pale cloudy straw color with about a finger of white head which left a few spots of lacing on the glass.  Aroma is grainy and citrusy.  Taste is light malty sweetness with some spices and a light hoppy bitter finish.  Light body and moderate carbonation leave a decent mouthfeel.  A decent witbier at best.

Very decent, considering the brand is usually limited to weak lager. Beer is on the same level as Hoegaarden in terms of flavors and aromas but the coriander and orange come through stronger which is not necessarily good. Slightly too much carbonation, however.

Bière blanche de 5 % d’alcool. Fruitée et rafraîchissante, moyen col au versement. Aucun arrière-goût, on goûte bien les agrumes. Petit goût d’épices, mais simplement pour ajouter à la beauté de la bière. Excellente !

33 cl, köpt på Systembolaget Hansa i Malmö. Ljusgul och grumlig kropp med ett stort härligt ljust skum som stannar kvar länge, länge. Doftar mycket citrus och koriander, smakar det samma samt inslag av blomster. Citrusen dominerar starkt vilket också medför en stor grad av surhet, som är fräsch.
330 ml blue bottle. Small head. Cloudy pale yellow color. Fruity taste. Not bad beer, but would not drink a lot in a row. A bit fruity for my taste.
Bottle. A thin head, faint aroma of grapefruit. Tastes like watered down grapefruit juice. I like it, but it’s not what I would expect from a beer necessarily.

Bottle. Strong sweet and fruity aroma. Appearance is kind of yellow and faintly lemony with a white head. Taste is not your typical Belgian white. It’s much sweeter and less wheaty. Thin and citrusy. Kind of like drinking a strawberry lemonade. Refreshing, inoffensive, but really quite uninspired.

330ml blue bottle. That’s unique. Aroma is sweet grain, citrus, floral and hints of spice and skunk. Cloudy pale yellow pour with medium foamy white head. Taste is wheat and orange peel, a little floral and a tiny touch of spice. Palate was a little thin, but refreshing. Overall, not bad, not great. If you like the style this is an acceptable offering.

Bottle found in Rogers (thx) refrigerator cons 2011-10-22 Göteborg
AR: citrus, peach flowers
AP: hazy colored body, wee white head
F: citric, peach flowers, medium bitterness, very fresh
Bottle at Moxys.  Pours slightly hazy, blonde in colour.  Decent white head.  Aroma and taste are lightly sweet, some fruity character, some wheat.  Drinkable.
Low quality in many respects but a very refreshing brew. A little too fake and fruity

Bottle at the Kick Off. Hazy gold, medium white cap. Smells really nice, peaches, pear, apple, yeast, lemon, wheat malt. Nice! Flavour is huge on the peach juice, like wow this is peachy. Balanced with some tart lemon character and some dry yeasty aspects. Feels light and good. I can’t get over the peach and lemon dominating yet in such a good way. Here’s an example of a macro brew which is exceedingly well done. I could easily drink this again, good job!
Typical macro belgian wit flavors. Light citus, wheat, and some honey. Quite watery though, thin dry finish. Pretty boring.

On tap at Atomic Rooster in Ottawa. Pale hazy yellow with a white head.  Smells like it was artificially sweetened, some wheat and orange, hints of yeast and citrus. Highly carbonated, thin and sweet, not well balanced, leaves sugary aftertaste on the palate. Had potential on the pour but pretty terrible.

Blue 330mL bottle from the LCBO.  Pours very pale yellow and extremely cloudy, like fizzy pineapple juice.  Aroma is sweet citrusy fruit punch, a bit artificial, with a hint of skunkiness.  Taste is full of sweet fruits, and not much else.  Refreshing, but not that great for a Wit.

330ml bottle 

5.0% ABV 

I tried this beer on September 14, 2011 after purchasing a 6 pack from one of my local LCBP outlets.  The beer poured a hazy yellow colour with no head.  The aroma was apricots and not much else....reminiscent of the apricot nectar my dad used to buy when I was a small child.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with medium-high carbonation.  The flavour was wheat malt, more appricots, and some mild skunkiness.  I must admit, I love the aroma of this beer!  Not your typical witbier, and I like that!

Large glass from draught in a Paris Cafe.  Citrus witbier, very nice.  Ok head over golden cloudt bier with a slice of lemon in it.  Strong citrus aroma.  Its not a genius beer but a nice one for a change.

Blonde trouble, laiteuse, mousse fugace. Nez fruité, blé et épices. La bouche est douce avec une acidulité et des notes d’orange et de coriandre. Peu d’amertume, pointe herbacée, rafraîchissante et légère. Une peu trop douce, Blanche passe-partout.
Cloudy yellow color with a small white head. Delicious aroma of lemon. Not much favour. But fine beer for a summer day.
Cloudy yellow, bubbly head. Aroma of lemon-citrus, pineapple. Light, refreshing, sweet.

Szalmasárga és zavaros. Kiöntve pezseg ami be is tesz a habnak. Illata nem túl búzás, gyengécske. Ízét uralja a citromos karakter. Végén fűszeres (koriander) kevés komlós/keserű utóízzel. Középen édes viszonylag száraz. A komló íze engem az Arany Ászokra emlékeztet. (De lehet, hogy Borsodi...)
Olyan, semmilyen.

Fancy blue bottle with a white label. Pours a hazy lemon yellow. Aroma is weird-- softly skunky euro-hop, wet hair, and oranges. Palate is even weirder-- dirty grains, no real wheat character to speak of, and gross curaçao orange essence. This tasted more like a shitty shandy than it did a wit. Poor.
Super fruity, right up the alley of Blue Moon or Schocktop drinkers. I also notied that this brand has about a million different beers.
Bottle. Smells like grapefruit and tastes like sweet lemonade. Not a big fan of sugar added to my beer. Pale yellow with a nice head. Refreshing but a bit sweet. Drinkable enough.

flavoured wheat beer, with glucose syrup, orange peel, and coridander. Light bodied beer with an orange blossom water taste, some creaminess, a bit of tang and citrus. Off-dry finish with a very mild short bitter finish. Short Length, Low-med complexity, low depth, but somewhat refreshing and sippable. Overall lacking in wow factor and quite predicable halfway through.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur jaune laiteuse et voilée. Nez fruité (bonbon aux pêches, léger d’abricots et d’agrumes), légèrement épicé (coriandre) avec des notes de blé. Moyenne-mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-bas et une texture moyennement crémeuse et aux petites notes aqueuses et sirupeuses fruitées. Goût fruité (léger de sirop de pêche, notes d’agrumes et d’abricots sucrés) avec des notes épicées (coriandre) lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen-léger goût de blé avec des traces de pain mouillé puis en finale l’on retrouve des notes herbeuses (herbes fraîches et herbes mouillées) avec de faibles traces florales. Post-goût moyen-court, composé de notes fruitées (notes de pelures d’abricots) et de traces de blé.
Bought from 7-11 in beers of the summer offer Taiwan. Mildly skunky with lemons/oranges and a syrupy floral finish. I really like this beer.

Aroma:skunk,fruity,citrus...
Appearance:cloudy yellow,light head...
Flavor:Fruity,citrus,bubble gum...

330 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a very cloudy straw yellow with moderate-sized white head.  Aroma of candied apricot/orange and a hint of coriander.  Taste is very sweet tropical fruit with again very subtle coriander.  Somewhat syrupy.  Too over the top on the sweetness but not a bad summer sipper for a commercial beer.

Bouteille bleue (!) de 330ml. Bière jaune laiteuse trouble, mousse blanche. Le nez est frais, d’agrumes, abricot, chanvre, coriandre. La bouche a du fizz, un peu à la manière d’une eau gazéifiée, les saveurs d’agrumes sont bien prononcée, pour la piscine et pour les femmes, plus près du shandie que de la bière.
Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, peachy, citrus and coriander. Flavor is medium sweet. Dry finish. 020707
Refreshing.  Good on a hot summer’s day.  Tastes like it’s infused with peaches instead of the usual orange.  It’s worth a try to all wheat beer drinkers!

Hmmm... flavoured wheat beer... normally I prefer beer without any artificial additives, such as glucose syrup and aromatic caramel flavour, but it does blend well with the orange peel, spices and coriander. Gives it a more fruity taste. Good summer sipper.
on tap at hotel bar in Paris.  nose and tastes of light citrus.  maybe hints of vanilla and little yeast.  kinda watery though.

Spritzig hefiger, leider aber zu künstlich süßer Antrunk. Auch die auftretende und weite Teile vordergründige Bananennote wirkt künstlich, das Bier steigert sich hier sogar noch. Ab dem späten Mittelteil etwas säuerlich, danach nehmen die Aromen schnell ab. Oberflächliches Wit, das zudem zu künstlich erscheint. 9/5/6/4/5/5

Played this bar called the Atomic Rooster in Ottawa and they had this one on tap. Pours a cloudy golden-beige with a small white head that leaves a small amount of lacing. The glass it came in from Kronenbourg is graduated frosty, so I thought the glass was chilled before serving. But no. It was not. The scent was of light oranges and hints of honey. The mouthfeel was thicker than I expected. The taste was different as well - Apricots, not orange zest, nor coriander. Overall, too mild (just like their popular 1664, but interesting because of the apricot flavour.

Bottle from Franprix.

Smells like fake peaches.

Tastes like Hoogarden mixed with Trolli-O peach candy.  I’m guessing they are using the same artificial flavor chemicals.

But it comes in a strange blue bottle with a white cap.
Opaque yellow,small white head.Vague tart nose and palate, all aspects are very muted. Not much here

on tap at l’autre oeil, gatineau. hazy very pale yellow, little to no head - and disappearing, some lacing. hiding wheat, faint malts, herbs, citrus - some lemon tartness. light to medium hopped - strong herbal feel with a touch of citrus. strong carbonation, very light body - watery. like a coors light with some haziness (not even from wheat) and a dash of lemon juice...

A - Citrus and spice
A - Very light and cloudy
T - Sour lemon
M - Thin
O - Lemon aid anyone
Colour is pale yellow cloudy and not as deep or murky as some wit/white beers. Flavour is very light and citrousy. Refreshing and easy to drink and not as complex as other white beers.
Decent wit, but it’s apparent in the flavour that artificial flavouring was used. It’s still pretty fresh with lot’s lemony notes, though I prefer a wit with real spices.

Absolutely a favourite from first sip. Love the aroma, the citrousy undertones, texture not too heavy. Could drink it every day. Had it on tap, and am under suspicion that they dilute it with water... Would like to try it elsewhere...  PEOPLE FROM VANCOUVER, BC - WHERE DO YOU FIND IT (other than Red Card)????

Pours hazy yellow with average white head. Citric aroma toguether with some herbs, coriander and maybe some yeast also. Refreshing taste, citrus and spiced. Light sweetness and lightly sour. Light body, oily feel, soft carbonation and a medium hebal spiced after taste. Good surprise.

2010-11-24. Hazy pastel yellow body with a small white head. Aroma is modestly yeast with hints of sweet lemon citrus and muted cereally wheat. Flavour is mild, lemony citrus accents and yeasty core. Tart wheat undertones, fairly mild overall. Average light palate. Better than I expected actually, but a bit thin overall. Draft at Highlander Pub, Ottawa

White bottle ! A lightly cloud yellow beer with medium head. Smell is low but with agrumes notes. Aroma is lightly malty, light body, sweet with a high lemony note (why is that needed ?) finish is short.

Quite a nice surprise. After the normal 1664, which was quite bad, this tasted really nice. A little bit too much lemon maybe, and slightly artificial, but not overly so. Very refreshing it is. Can drink a lot of these. Sun is required though. Luckily, I’m in France, so that’s no problem here.

Verre de dégustation, provenant d’un fût, dégusté au Festival Bières et Saveurs 2010 (Chambly, QC). Arôme: Odeur de pêche avec une pointe d’oranges et de coriandre. Apparence: La couleur est blonde blanchâtre opaque. Présence d’un mince col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales avec une pointe de pêches et d’oranges. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence d’oranges en arrière goût. (Rating #3260)

Bottle at a cafe in La Defense on the outskirts of Paris.  One of the only places actually open for dinner, as this concrete jungle of an office park definitely empties out in the evening as everyone returns to the city proper.  Pours a very light hazy yellow.  Aroma grainy wheat and orange and lemon citrus.  Flavor is a match, with some very light coriander providing a touch of bitterness on the finish.  Although refreshing, it came off as somewhat soda like somehow.

Draught @ restaurant Cella, Helsinki. Clowdy yellow colour with a thick, white head. Citric aroma with some yeast and wheat. Flavour mainly of citric character, but some hoppy bitterness in the finish, too. Quite crisply carbonated. Not very noteworthy, but not too bad either.

Bottle (blue one).
White and cloudy, with a high and lasting head.
Yeasty and citrus notes in aroma, with a bit of coriander.
Malt and wheat in taste, then a little citrusy and a nice coriander finish.

From bottle (Carrefour) Argenton, France. Tasted on 03.08.2010.
Hazy yellow color, with white head.
Aroma lemon, malts, spice (coriander).
Medium body.
Taste coriander, lemon juice, wheat malts.
drinkable. Like the Grimbergen version more.
Draught. Pours nearly opaque light yellow with huge, dense head. Taste is sweet with hint of tartness. Palate has an oily mouthfeel. Aromas have honey, fruits.

After the beer was served in the glass there was found a lasting quantity not wall adhesive white foam collar which was fine and even of structure. The beer also contained normale carbonic acid in the glass. 

The beer has a thick pale color and a sweet taste. The after tast of the beer is hoppy bitter with a citrus touch. This beer smells fruity.

Keg (Angleterre, Helsinki)

5 wheaty and corny aroma

3 Fairly cloudy wheat colour, tiny head

6 perfumey retronasals, fruity bubblegum too, but strangely lots of pulses too

3 crisp carbonation, slightly thin palate. finish surprisingly hoppy just simple papery noble hops, but hops nonetheless. 

11 very quirky wheat, very sweet and fruity. weirdly tasty.
Tap in Montreal - Hazy yellow, pronounced Lemon Pledge nose, lemonade palate with a little chalky finish.  Not notable in the least.
Golden with nice head. Aroma hops, yeast, fruit (apricot, peach, citrus, banana). Taste sour sweet with yeast and fruit. Light body, text thin, carb fizzy. Finish sour bitter

A hazed yellow blonde wit with a thick creamy white head. In aroma, berries and bananas, with light sulfur notes. In mouth, a lemony banana taste, with light berries, and cloves. Not bad. Medium bodied. On tap at a café on Mozart St. in Paris, 8 euros for 500mL!

Tap in Paris, France.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a nice, thick white head.  Aroma is Sweet-N-Low lemon and tart citrus.  Flavor is pleasant lemon and sugar, and it finishes with light floral notes.  Average mouthfeel.  Nice beer; refreshing.
Bottle form  total wine (Import section) hazy white pour with a bread aroma. This in taste with a mild fruit and yeast taste. I was not impressed.

330ml bottle, sampled at the Gainzbar, light cloudy yellow hue, with a frothy white head, yeasty, fruity nose of pineapple, pear, litchi, fruit salade esters, with some mild honeyed pale, toasted, wheat malt notes, with some orange peel, curaçao, coriander accents and faint lactose sweetness in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, fruity, kind of artificial fructose sweet character of fruit salade, with some artificial pink grapefruit juice, candied lemon peel flavours, with some light honeyish wheat, pale, pilsener malt accents, with a spicy curaçao, coriander spiciness, leading towards a sweet juicy, zesty, lemony, wheaty finish.

On Tap at West 50 in Mississauga.

I’ve only had the pleasure of trying this ONCE, when I took a date to West 50.  I remember it being a nice cloudy golden color, and had a small white foamy head.  But I specifically recall the aroma AND flavor being very heavy on banana, which I actually really enjoyed and found super refreshing. 

Was very disappointed to hear that this is unavailable for purchase at the beer store nor LCBO for myself at home.   PLEASE START SELLING THIS BEER in Ontario!
Lemon, citrus, frutiy, and spice aroma.  Hazy yellow with frothy white head.  Very fruity with medium sour / bitterness.  Fizzy with mild bitter finish.

lemony with a hint of coriander. cloudy blanche in colour yet too sparkling.
Overall I didn’t dislike it too much.
Light yellow hazy body and white head. Heavy citrus and coriander. Heavy spiced. Medium sweet. Bitterness is not exiting. Reminds me of water from the dish washer!
Golden with white head - this beer is dominated with citrus that olmost covers all other flavours - not that good, perhaps this will be bether on a really hot summer day

Bonus point for the cool blue bottle, this stuff looks really slick inside and outside of the bottle - nice head, good wheatbeer yellow going on. Smells very lemony, with a hint of grains. Tastes like lemon juice intermixed with wheat beer - almost like a shandy. Very smooth for five percent, though. A nice attempt at something new, and very drinkable, but lacks complexity.

Quando l’ho comprata aspettavo il peggio; non ho potuto resistere e ho letto qualcosina qua così ho pensato ancora a peggio. Poi l’ho versata e mi sono sentito un poco sollevato, perché l’aroma non sembrava estremamente offensivo se pure un po’ tanto limonoso; però l’assaggio ha ridimensionato il mio sollievo e buona parte del bicchiere è finita nel cesso. Non la peggiore blanche che abbia assaggiato, ma sicuramente una birra inutile, limonata pura e peggio anche della Hoegaarden, fidarsi! 33cl latta dal besagnin

Bottle bought in Osaka.
Light yellow color, thin looking, with a small head. Not a whole lot of aroma—a little wheat malt, some cloves or coriander, citrus. Surprising little aroma. Strong citrus taste, a little fake, certainly from orange or maybe lemon. Coriander as well. Not much wheat malt or other malt in the flavor, Thin. More like a soda or a mixed drink than a witbier. Crap.

Draught at The Monk’s Table. Lovely hazy pale yellow with a large snow white head. Aroma has a lot of orange notes, with a mild spiciness and a hint of wheat husks. Nice refreshing body, and very pleasant flavour - a touch too sweet for the style, maybe, but still a nice orange character with a touch of lemon and grapefruit and some mellow spiciness. Surprisingly good!

On tap at L’Autre Oeil &#40Gatineau, QC&#41. Cloudy pale blond body with a thin white creamy head. Decent malty/hoppy aroma with yeasty and citrusy hints. Taste is slightly misbalanced. It is dominated by maltiness and it ends with a short bittersweet finish. Not bad, but still under the average for a Witbier.

Draught at Sharkey’s World Café & Lounge. Pours a hazy yellow with an average size diminishing creamy white head. Mild aroma of bananas, pretty sweet, like banana candy, along with some wheat and very light spices. Watery flavour of wheat, light spices, light banana and citrus and some sugary sweetness. Light to average bodied. You know, this isn’t that bad, it’s not a world-class version of the style but it’s fine enough that I’d drink it again.

Electric blue bottle, 33 cl, best before 03.10, gift from the outaouais rep &#40merci!&#41, received on August 20 2009, savoured on August 27 2009; eye: citrus with a good whitish hue, hazy, white head, average lacing; nose: wheat, “artificial”, sugar additive, light coriander, orange, citrus; mouth: wheat, “artificial”, sugar additive, light coriander, orange, citrus, wheat-orange finale, rather carbonated, thin-medium body, mildly sweet, thin; overall: ordinary

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille  bleu électrique, 33 cl, meilleure avant 03.10, cadeau du représentant outaouais &#40merci!&#41, reçu le 20 août 2009, savourée le 27 août 2009; œil : citron avec une bonne teinte blanchâtre, voilée, mousse blanche, dentelle moyenne; nez : froment, « artificiel », additif sucré, léger coriandre, orange, citron; bouche : froment, « artificiel », additif sucré, léger coriandre, orange, citron, finale froment-orange, plutôt carbonatée, corps mince-moyen, moyennement sucrée, mince; en résumé : ordinaire

Bottle@Home. Instead of having to put a slice of lemon on your glass of Witbier at Kronenbourg they’ve decided to put the lemon in their bottles is seems. And guess what: I really don’t like a slice of lemon with my Witbier.

Pours similar to a pale lager, aroma is very fruity, particulalry orange.  Taste is an odd one to work out, starts off fruity, light and quite refreshing, but this quickly gives way to artificial fruit flavours, like apple and orange icepop flavourings mixed with a dry white beer.  Rather wierd and not pleasant after a few centimeters.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are rich wheat malt, hops, yeast and citrus notes.
Bad example of a wheat beer. Plenty of weird and rather unnatural fruity flavours however. pretty much everything i’d expect from a kronenbourg beer.

Draft in random Paris cafe. Hazy pale yellow-beige with nice white lasting head. Bright orange aroma also lemons. Inviting witbier smells. Soft mouthfeel. Pretty thin, but has a nice lingering wheat finish and a balanced flavor profile. Refreshing citrus up front with good grain backbone boosting the body. Pretty nice and way better than expected.
Almost greyish - yellow and kind of anemic.  Fresh orange juice/coriander nose.  Very peach - fruity.  The body is both wheaty and creamy.  Very grapefruity in the finish.
A really fruity aroma. Also alot of herbs. A sour taste. Not that bad. But not what i expected from a beer.

Tap. One of the most artificial flavours I’ve experienced in a beer. Damn weird stuff. It’s not maybe that bad, but artificial feeling destroyed the impression and shocked me that much, that I didn’t even finish it.

One big bottle from the shop.
Lol, well I don’t mind a good quality wheat beer at the end of the day but this is a very poor effort. The Artifical fruit flavours completely stand out for this beer, I wonder really what they actually put into this beer. I would not pay anything like the prices they suggest for it.

Bottle. Pours opaque white-yellow with thin head. Strong aroma of fruit (apricots, lemons), herbs (lemongrass, lemon verbena), and noble german hops (Hersbrucker?), with some fermentation characteristics (slightly phenolic sourness and DMS). A bit thin body. Nice sourness compliments the citrus fruit. Finishes sour and dry.

Can. In aroma i can find some herbs, citrus, apple, floral hops; a bit cloudy liquid, 
 At finish there is some sourness in the roof of the mouth.
It is  very very fruity for me, like bubblegum for kids.
Light and floral aroma, crisp and fruity taste with a hint of peach and lemon. Excellent beer with a refreshing taste for those sunny evenings.
Draught. Pours with a cloudy appearance, with decent white head. Very citrusy, both on the nose and the palate, with a slight sourness also on the palate. Quite a clear and crisp mouthfeel.

Draught at Cella, Helsinki, Finland.
Very hard to rate. This is not a regular witbier. Far from it. This is very FRUITY. More like fruit-juice than witbier. Anyway it is refreshing when you are having one.

500 mL bottle. Found this in Ireland. Pours almost a neon, cloudy light yellow with a decent white head. Aroma is very floral, lemony, and spicy. Taste is watery with lots of lemon, grapefruit, coriander, and slight soapiness. I’m missing the yeast and cloves components. Decent, refreshing, light. But not very good for the style.

Thorups, Aarhus, DK.
On tap, 211108.
Unclear white-light yellow. Aroma of coriander and floral notes. Flavor is citric with notes of yeast and wheat.

Not so bad as the others rated it. I’ve tasted a better item? So my beer has a pale yellow hazy appearance and a delicious white lacing head. In the nose i can feel some coriander, some honey and the topfermentation phenolic wheat perfume. The flavor was  about citruses, some spices and a hint of yeast and wheat and honey too. It was fine. i don’t care the other raters:)
this is a sweet and tangy beer, with some nice malt and slight citrus. Very refreshing.

500ml bottle. There are similarities between this and Hoegaarden. There is a large white head, followed by yellow/orange colours. The taste is of a sweet citrus flavour, notice some lime, lemon and orange. A bit too like sweet orangeade for me Bottle is unique though.

Huge, dense head leaving shards of lace over hazy greenish-yellow, nearly fluorescent beer. Spicy, coriander in particular, soupy, faint (fake) citrus, but fresh-smelling. Wry, spicy taste. Coriander still obvious, but not imposing upon all other flavours; as the earthy, root-spice flavour proves. Faint citrus hints, as from diluted, sparkling lemonade. Refreshing, wheat slickness, creamy texture of the head, but empty in the end. Light, typical summerwheat for as large a public as possible.
24.01.2007, 0,33l bottle, Cardinal, Stavanger. The beer is yellow and hazy. The smell and the aroma is dominated by lemon and apple.

A wonderful wheat beer that ranks right up there along side some of the great German and other continental wheat beers such as Hacker Pscorr Weiss beer, Erdinger and the classic Belgian Wheat beer Hoegarden.  It has a wonderful texture and crisp fruity citrus flavours as it hits the palate.  A truley wonderful beer!
0,5 l bottle in York. Hazy yellow color, nice white head. Aroma is citric, wheat, yeast. Flavor is wheat, citrus, yeast. Ok witbier.

Appearance: Pale yellow, hazy. Little bit of white head.
Aroma: Very fruity, lemony. Some wheat.
Taste: Pretty fruity, and sweet. Bit of wheat. Peaches?
Info: 500ml bottle, 19/9-2007

On tap in Paris.  Cloudy pale yellow beer.  Great citrus aroma.  Kind of dusty on the palate with more citrus, crisp.

An odd, but pleasant wit.  Good summer beer.

My wife took one sip and proclaimed "lemon poppyseed bread".  I could imagine the poppyseeds floating in the beer.

Hardly a head on this near-white body. There is an obvious citrus tast, which make it even frescher. I’d say this is a perfect sommer beer. Usually I a not enthusiastic about Kronenbourg, but I’ll make an exception in this case.
a complex easy to drink witbier. very nice taste of fruit flowers citrus and wheat. one of my favorite witbiers

500 ml. bottle; BB 300808. Pours a light hazy gold color with a respectable white head. Aromas of wheat, lemon and coriander. Starts sweet with citrus peel and mild spice. Could be a small touch of clove. Near medium body with fizzy carbonation. Really quite decent to drink.

[500ml bottle from Sainsbury’s Reading] Slightly cloudy, negligible head.  Moderate carbonation.  Taste initially citrus - grapefruit, lemon, maybe lime.  Develops through maltiness into a strong wheaty flavour - like the smell of a combine harvester with a strong hint of pineapple.  Quite sweet - could maybe do with a touch more hops.  So far so good, but the texture is a little too weak and watery, whilst there is a slightly unpleasant sourness in the aftertaste.
Hazy yellow with medium white head. Sweet fruity aroma peachy and mango notes. Sweet flavor with wheat, mango and yeasty notes.

33 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow to orange with a chalk white head. Citrus fruity aroma. Mango fruit perhaps.flavour is a bit more dry yet with a light mango fruity note. Ends with a medium dry mango fruit flavour.
small white head on a hazy orangy yellow  beer. lemon and lime, some other sweet fruit.

Rated: 23.04.2008

Bottle deep blue, 330 ml

Appearance: Pours citrussy, like lemon juice with some milk, metallic yellowish, carbonation of body is medium, head is initially rather small, white, foamy to fizzy, quickly decreasing to minimal

Aroma: Peach, very intensive aroma of peach in deed, juicy, very gentle, some notes of whipped cream, milk, wheat, lemon, lime, gentle yeasts, cookie, coconut, grain, flowery, perfume, sweet, orange, candid fruit, initially slightly mineral nose, vanilla.

Flavour: Front is sour, accidic, vinegar like, without a note of sweetness, spicy, than some gentle warmth on palate and fantastic, gentle efferrescence, some citrussess, lime, orange, lemon, wheat, grainy, rafreshing, some watered yeasts. Distinctive, well balanced taste. Finish duration is short.

Palate: Body is light, texture is wattery, carbonation on palate is lively, finish feel is grainy, fresh, soft, clean, sparkling due to intensive efferrescence, very gentle, alcohol well hidden, no chalkyness, some hints of mineral and metal.

Bottle. [Courtesy of yespr, thanks buddy] Average fine bubbled white head that mostly diminished. Good display of lacework. Cloudy golden orange colour. Aroma of pepper, skunk, pot, citrus, herbal, toasted malt. Light bodied with an average carbonation. Light sweet and bitter flavour.  Light bitter herbal finish.

Pint in a pub. That cost me £4.50. A scandel. This isn’t some rare, artisan beer from the far corner of northern France; its bulk brewed session beer, but hey, any excuse to rip off the British drinker. Now I will climb off my soap box and rate it. Looks like banana milkshake, tastes like a Witbier someone has tipped a teaspoon of peach essence into. Some wheat in there, but killed by citrus fruit. Its kind of ok hot day drinking beer, but not at the price, sorry.
Blue bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Greenisch pale yellow colour. Powerfull lemon aroma and flavopr. Very artificial. Harsh kinin bitterness. Average finish. Watery palate. Bad stuff.

Tap. Nose is a lemony hoppy typical whitebeer smell, but the lemony seems almost adjunct. Mouth is refreshing and long, some funky hops, lemony and some yeast. Quite refreshing, if a little sweet. Alright, but not a showstopper

33cl. bottle. nice bottle btw. blue... smells like a fruit beer(lime or lemon beer), looks nice. looks matches the taste.  hazy, white fine foam. Flavor is "pilsener with lemon/limejuice" and if you like that, it’s good. Quite refreshing. Overall they didn’t do anything wrong, it’s just not up my alley. Good for hot weather with the lemon taste, and lightness.
Unclear yellow of color with a white head. An aroma of peach, apricot, spice and fruits. A flavor of spice and fruits.

Pici 2,5 decis üvegben kapható./Hál Istennek!/Kissé zavaros sárga színű termék,gyorsan elillanó hálós habbal.Illata már több mint gyanús,valamelyik fűszertől kissé büdi!Az íze egyszerűen borzalmas!Imádom a búzasöröket,de ez nem az!Olyan mintha egy pohár élesztőbe citromot,koriandert és valami mezei füvet poshasztottak volna! Atomcraft nein,danke!

3-21-08 bottle shared at tasting 


Cloudy pastel pale yellow with a thin head.  Orangina and lime juice smell.  Fruity whitbier flavor with a light citris finish.  Highly carbonated palate.

Bottle shared at tasting. Thanks! 

Not surprised that one of my preferred witbiers is one of the lower rated ones, as I typically don’t like the style...
Pours cloudy, hazy and yellowish.  Smell is like orangina.  Strong citrusy and fresh with a slight bit of yeast behind that, perhaps.  
Taste is dry, wheaty and orange, and refreshing and easy to drink.  Nice carbonation and body.  Pretty nice, I thought, but I’m not too knowledgable on the style.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow/green:ish with creamy head. Fresh aroma of citrus and bubblegum. Weird, almost dry, taste of pineapple, spice and more bubblegum. Quite watery, however, and not much of a finish. Rather interesting on the whole, and very refreshing. Is it really a beer?

Vastly underated in my opinion. This use to be a favorite of mine before I was into beer. It pours with a creamy white head with good lacing and retention. Hazy, light yellow body with plenty of bubbles running up the side. Smells very fruity with lemon (not hoppy lemon, but the fruit), blueberry and pineapple. Taste might be a bit artificial, but it is lightly citrusy and just as ultra refreshing as I remember. Dry mouth and bubbly carbonation; "palate" is the weakest part of this beer

Bottle.  Super sweet pineapple/banana aroma.  Cloudy light yellow with small head.  Sweet pineapple juice and wheat malt flavor.  Like no other witbier I’ve ever had - this is more like a US brewpub’s fruit beer or a light version of the sweet fruit lambics.

Muddy blond color, with big head. It has a very artificial aroma, of lemon; also spicy and soapy. Quite sweet, with just a light wheat touch, as well as spicy/lemony/soapy impression. It’s drinkable just because it’s sweet, but I have a serious conscience problem here. So fake!
Just keep in mind that it’s brewed with corn and wheat (no barley) and with artificial flavorings…

Wheat beers need to be drunk in gulps and therefore a 33cl bottle is not enough. This beer has a cloudy, warm, but pale, yellow appearance and a thick, very white head. Good lacing. Being partial when it comes to wheat beers I might be bias, but I did find this beer pretty pleasurable. My 10 yr old reckoned it smelt of pizza. I then realized the oregano smell and flavour was quite strong. It also tastes strongly of lemon and grapefruit. I am sure stronger carbonation would have been to its advantage.

Bottle. Thin dense white head. Foggy pale yellow colored body. Chemical and artificial lemon aroma. Notes of perfume and spices. Dry and light sour fruit flavors. Thin and sharp mouthfeel. Not impressive... a Witbier-wannabe.

Bottle. Pale, hazy gold with a big white head. Off-putting aroma of stale grain, coriander, citrus and yeast. The mouth feel was soupy with more coriander, indeterminate spices and a rough, sour finish. In my experience, the worst wheat beer.

Hazy yellow with a dense white head. Aroma of lemon and some othe sweet fruit, maybe pineapple along with some minor notes of fermented green grapes. Flavor was pretty sour, like a bad dry whitewine mixed with a regular pale lager. Wierd that the flavor wasnt sweet, considering the aroma. High on carbonation.

Re-rate - Jesus Mary and Joseph this even worse than I first thought. Tastes like the emptied water from a vase of flowers, strained through a bowl of pot pourri, add a dash of washing up liquid, ferment in a ladies handbag. Bit watery, fruitier than Carmen Miranda’s hat and sour. Doesn’t sit nice on the belly.
Bought a bottle from morrisons. Expected a bit more than just that watery sour taste with a hint of fruit. No, not for me.
Bottled sample.  Orange peel/lime aroma.  Pours with a cloudy yellow hue and frothy white head.  Sour lemon/lime and orange peel flavour.  Some spicey hints and a dry-ish finish.

[659-20070922] Cask @ The Magdalen (Oxford, OX). Aroma holds tangy fruit spices. Hazy, yellow body with a big medium-lasting foamy white head. Sour grapefruit citrus peel flavour hints at straw. Medium body. Interesting and different, but not particularly repeatable.
Bought for the bottle, always a mistake. This beer is sadly an acquired taste, it is very sour. Dark, cloudy colour promises something good, maybe I got a duff one.
The aroma is sour perhaps some grape fruit too. The flavor is also sour with a twist of grape - there is no aftertaste!
Bottle at Dæmningen 37. Cloudy yellow - white head. Citrus, spices, wheat, fruity, bubblegum, candy, freshness, watery thin body and finish.

While entering about 30 ratings, this one turned out as #1100, which I just couldn’t accept, so I deleted it and am now re-entering it. Was going to bring a couple bottles of this home as they are nips, which meant one for me and one for Eugene, as I know he collects them. Well, not real nips, 8 oz, but close enough. Space ran out though, so I decided to just drink mine and toss Eugene’s. Hah! This shit sucks, though, I’d be embarassed to even have it on my wall, despite the size. Very fizzy head, aroma is your typical nasty cheap beer, with maybe a little coriander. Slight spices in the tastes, a little tiny bit Belgian yeast, but very raw and unfortunate. Tastes like spoiled cheese. Thin. Do not drink this.

Sampled @ The Prince of Wales, Shrivenham. Pale yellow in colour with some haze. Aromas of lemon, ridiculously strong tropical (mango and especially papaya), and light coriander. Lemon/lime flavors and sourness levels dominate the palate. Although the tropical notes are totally over the top and artificial tasting, the spice level seems about right. Yes, it’s not great, but at least they got one note right.
Yes a should know better and yes it was synthetic and contrived.  Nevertheless was a nice spritzy citrusy beer with alot going for it.  Nice as a novelty.  Good marks to be chemists.

A Mes rate: Draught some where... I care not where...
Awful. Synthentic attempt at a wit in a desperate attempt to claw back some of the drinkers who may have started on 1664 and since become more discerning. Thing is they now wouldn’t touch this crap with a barge pole, unless of course they happen to be a daft rater dork like me. Bag o’ shite. Lemon flavoured card. Over carbed. Really I can’t be bothered.

Aroma/-light,
Appearance Head/small,
Head/Color-white,
Head/Longevity-fully diminishing, Body/Hue-cloudy,
Palate Body/light

Canned, hazy white coloured beer with some light carbonation and a medium white head. Sweet fruity, herby (honey?) aroma. Medium palate. Finish is sweet fruity, herby, strange maybe to sweet, artificial aromated/flavoured beer.

Pours a cloudy body that is lightly yellow, with a thin creamy head that fades to a white  layer.
Aroma is extremely fruity of peaches.
Flavor is very strongly peachy to, almost like peach candy.
Palate is thin and syrupy.

(Bottle) Pale yellow colour, hazy, with big frothy white, but brief, head. Fruity, sweetish, slightly spicy nose with notes of lemon, pineapple, coriander and a hint of ginger. Fruity taste with lemon, pineapple, notes of coriander and a hint of wheat dough. Short finish, no bitterness, thin body. A bit too sweet with bubblegum notes. However, not bad at all, actually better than expected. But there are lots of more interesting belgian witbiers out there.
Hazy yellow with a small head. Quite sweet, some citrus and peach. Poorly balanced. Thumbs down.
citrus, pale, cloudy, a minimal head, white foam, medium sourness, vinegar, light body, slick feel, fizzy, long finish,

Had this in a can at an Auto Grill in France...at least I think it was this. The can labeling is not consistent with anything on the site, but it was definitely trying to be a witbier. Aluminum can smell and orange. Syrup and malt followed by a very metallic taste. High carbonation and a watery body. VERY sorry excuse for a wit, but not horrible I suppose.
bottle, bought in England. Looks all right but is full of ridiculously artificial fruit flavours. It gives to me the impresion of a bad copy of a Belgian witbier - didn’t like it at all.

Pours a hazy, light straw with a nice foamy head.  Citrus, banana, pineapple, and peach.  Pretty inviting aroma.  Flavor is similar to the aroma but muted.  Citrus, banana, and pineapple with some yeast.  Medium/thin body.  It’s not bad, but not what I expect in a witbier.

Pours a cloudy yellowish color with a lacy white head.  Aroma is citrus with a vague vanilla characteristic.  Taste is the same.  Not bad, but there’s just something off about this beer, and I can’t quite put my finger on what it is.

330 ml bottle. Cloudy whitish yellow colour. Throws atall fine-laced white head. Soapy and metallic lemon aroma. Soft texture. Flavour is much like Pez. Smooth wheat flavours and lots of citrus, mostly lemon. Nicely balanced, but feels somewhat artificial. That said it is quite drinkable and refreshing.
300 ml bottle. Nice bottle.  I will never drink this beer again. Taste is really bad.
Beer 111 Summer 2006 trip in Europe.  Drank on 7/22/06 @ a little side walk kiosk in Copenhagen.  Not bad, had to try it for the bottle and my friend Josh who used to love Kronenbourg.

25cl bottle.  Citrus aroma, with hints of sourness.  Pours cloudy yellow.  Flavor is actually nice, reminds me of a berliner weisse mixed with a wit, berliner wit?  ha.  seriously though, good citrus flavor, orange with lemons, some nice tartness, with spices and some sweetness.  The more i drank the more pineapple i got.  not great not horrible.
Pours hazy pale yellow. Citric aroma. Taste is lemon and sweet. Very watery.

Bottle, poured a very ugly milky pale gold with a tightly foamed white head. A very strong zesty cirtus aroma with the apricot coming through cleanly as well - actually smells good. The mouthfeel is a little like thin and off milk - hardly appertising. Someone said the flavour is like diluted orange juice, and that is spot on. A little yeast coming through, but not much like your typical (enjoyable) witbeir. Though better than your standard Kronenbourg - but that’s not saying much.

Best bit of this one is appearance - Cloudy peach colour with thick creamy white head. Unbalanced. Strong citrus aroma, flavour apricot, lemon. Thin mouthfeel, refreshing but over sweet and very artificial tasting. A little ’beer flavour’ on the swallow. Aftertaste a little cacky. Pretty unconvincing as a wit, and very overpriced. Poor.

[Blue bottle] Pale, hazy yellow. Dense head. Strong citrus aroma. Watery mouth feel; tastes like diluted orange juice. Witbier has never been one of my favourite styles and this certianly didn’t help.

Draft. Poured a hazy whitish-yellow color. Bubbly white disappearing head that left a bit of tattered lace behind. Strong lemony citrus aroma and flavor supported by only a touch of coriander and a little yeasty bread dough. More like a spiced lemon lime soda that a wit.
Light yellow color. Unclear. Has a white head, medium lasting. Aroma of citrus, flowers, perfume. A bid acidity, lemon, acetic-acid in flavor. Very carbonated.
From a can, hazy yellow with a nice head.  Aroma was wheaty and citrus as was the flavour but with a syrupy fake sweeter note.

The clumsiest and most cynical attempt at a style I’ve ever encountered. Hideously sugary, neat cordial/ Rowntree’s pineapple jelly nose. A tongue-curlingly artificial attack of sicky citric fruit and vile aspartame bitterness. Redeemed only by a fleeting wheaty note after the swallow. It’s not often I find a beer genuinely offensive to the senses, but this is something else. A disgracefully chemical attempt to cash-in on the lucrative popularity of Hoegaarden etc. Smirnoff Ice and RWhites brew better beers than this.
Hazy yellow body. White head. Arom and flavor is very citrus and fruity. Frech but to much citrus..
(300ml bottle) Excellent fruity aroma. Nice, citrusy wheat beer with a hint of bitter. Fresh summer beer.
Cloudy and lemony with a hint of stable in the aroma. Quite thin but refreshing enough. Very yeasty.

Bottled.  Muddy pale yellow, lively head. Candy and estery bubblegum up front. Sweet, fruity and sweaty with evident flavour of lemony washing up liquid. Mellow and unrefined, rather thin. Very artificial and cloying. Not refreshing at all. Mega-swill in disguise.

Bottled. Cloudy pale golswn. Small white head. Lemon and used bubblegum in the aroma, hints of seaweed. Thin flavour of lemon and bubblegum and citric sweets. Light-bodied with a short finish of salt (or is it seawead, I dont know...)

Aroma: alot of grapefruit, spicy, yeasty, very nice. Hints of raspberry and coriander aswell. Citrusy. 

Appearance.: cloudy lemon colour, some white head, the witstyle. 

Flavour: slightly sourish and very fruity. Grapefruit here too. Slightly sweet and wheaty aswell. A bit too light and fruity for me. Almost floral. Charming.
Aftertaste of violet. 

Palate: very easy and thin, more like soda than beer. However, not remarkable in any way.

Bottled. 
Hazy pale golden colour. Pretty fast diminishing head. Juicy citric backbone in aroma, with a bit of wheat and hints of choriander. Juicy lime-citric-orangey flavour that feels pretty fresh. Lemonade feel overall and the body is light, yet not as light on its feet as the better Wts.

Bottle. Pale yellow, hazy, large white head. Spicy, perfumy malt aroma with strong notes of lemon, mango and other tropical fruits. Very odd aroma, cannot really decide whether I like it or not. Light in body, and spritzy CO2. Nicely balanced. Interesting, but after half the bottle I get tired of the aroma.

Botlled.
Hazy yellow. Large white head.
Sweet citric-aroma.
Lot of co2 and not much flavour, really. Lemon and pineapple. No bitterness.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a small white head. Synthetic aroma of pineapple & citrus. Fruity, a little bit spicy flavour with more pineapples. A summer beer.

Bottle: Hazy yelow colour, with a white head. Aroma of: Lots Citrus,lemmon,orange, werry strange aroma.
Flavor is lemon,citric,sparkling mouth feeling,thin to medium body,sweet chemical,strange mouth feeling too.Short to medium finish. 
Werry nice Blue Bottle.
clowdy very pale yellow, lemon citrus aroma, quite neutral at first with slight hint of a wheat beer, with hints of apple and lemon
Medium, lasting head, opaque appearence. Fruity, sweet, orange-like flavour, but surprisingly not sweet at all in terms of taste. Refreshing, a nice surprise.
a decent flavoured wheat beer, a cloudy appearance and not too strong a taste.

On tap@BeerPalace Oslo. Hazy yellow body with a thin white head. Aroma is like lemon/citrus or something with yeast. Flavor is very fresh, almost a bit like cider and wit beer. Body is rather watery. This is like a mix of cider and wit in any prospect. A strange beer but very refreshing indeed.

Straw, hazy with a nice head. Both aroma have notes of peach in an artificial way. It’s rather sweet and as time goes by I find this more and more soda like. Probably a good start, if you aren’t yet fond of wheat beers. 1597
Bottle. Yellow hazy colour. Almost no head. Refreshing taste. Taste like Beer mixed with soda.
Draft from Archway Tavern.  Pale yellow with no head. Bland citrus nose with hops and a taste to match. Something artificial about it, blah.
bottled. absolutely horrendous. surgical dressing aroma. tasted of yoghurt and orange syrup. words can’t express how utterly undrinkable this is

500ml bottle, from Tesco. Pale yellow/apricot colour with that pallid peachy cast sometimes found in traditional perries. Not much head. Not much aroma either. Very citric on the palate with lemon to the fore, although there are orange and grapefruit undertones too. This gives the beer a rather sharp feel but there’s hidden sweetness too. Definite feel of orange squash or bitter lemon to it. The tart aftertaste lingers long after everything else has left the building. Nothing like a Belgian wit, but I guess it could provide some anodyne refreshment on a hot Summer’s day. Which this was not.
As close as you can get to *not* drinking beer.. But very refreshing, and, I guess, a beer worth serving for people, who "does not like beer".

Bottle. Hazy pale yellow colour with a  mostly diminishing small creamy white head. Sweet very fruity orange wheaty aroma. Flavour is smooth and sweet with wheat, plenty of orange fruitiness, bit sour, good barley. Long sweetish very fruity finish. On a hot summer day this soda pop beer would be perfect for a thirsty soul.

Clouded lemony orange hue like robsons Orange barley water.  Thin white foamy head and fairly lively carbonation.  Citrussy lemon and grapefruit nose.  Fruity citrus and orange taste that is rather thin and tastes a little like orange barley water.  No hops in evidence. Thin and disappointing.
Bottled in London. Very pale yellow. A sour beer, more like a cider than a beer. Another attempt to sell beer to people who don’t like beer?
Colour is very light yellow. Very fruity aroma. Lively taste. A refreshing beer for a hot summer day.

This beer is not a hearty or full beer, it is however a lovely companion on a hot, humid day.  I had this beer in that context, and i must say it is the perfect beer for said situation.  It is very pale, and the carbonation and flavor will remind you a bit of champagne.  As has been said there are a number of fruit flavors present, and they do overshadow the hops, but they are present.  If it were available (and properly marketed) in America it would sell like hotcakes since there are so many guys who cant drink beer (and would rather not be seen with a ZIMA).  In all this is not a beer geeks beer, but it is very refreshing and retains beer qualities despite a lot of frutiness.

Well. This doesn’t taste like a beer to me. It tastes more like cider. It’s very citric, sour apples, fruity. Clearly made for status-seeking people, who think they’d look cool holding this bottle at a club. (It’s supposed to be drank straight from bottle).

Bottle  0,3l. Bright golden. Unclear. A good-looking white head. Sweet fruity aroma. A bit artificial / candy-like flavour with hints of apricot. More fruity hints in the long aftertaste. Hardly any bitterness.

Can from Air France. Hazy yellow color with an average fizzy white head that was mostly lasting with good lacing. Moderate banana and sour citrus aroma. Light body with soft carbonation. Light citrus flavor with a light sweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations were met.
A laughable effort by Kronenbourg at producing a German/Belgian style white beer.  It looks the part (i.e. yellow and cloudy), but tastes disgusting - I would say of bubble gum!  Overall - rubbish
Bottle. Clear golden colour with a small white head. Very fruity (citrus) aroma and flavour.
I didn’t know whether to love or hate this beer. New experience for me - fruit beer. Will need to rerate. Verrrry citrusy

(Bottle BB 30/04/07) Citrus-fruity aroma. Hazy, light golden colour and white, small, almost fully diminishing head with fair lacing. Strongly fruity (citrus), slightly coriander and slightly sour flavour. Light to medium-bodied and lively carbonated. Refreshing one but nothing special! 05/10/06
had on tap. a off white murky color. with a strong lemon and lime flavor. and smell

Bottle, 500ml. A cloudy pale yellow colour with a small head. Slight disinfectant aroma with white chocolate and peach. Taste is quite sweet with citrus, artificial peach, corriander and grapefruit. No wheat flavour or aroma at all. A sweet, slightly sour finish. Moderate carbonation. I don’t know what this is supposed to be, but it is nothing like a Witbier.

Draught.  Cloudy yellow with a long lasting small white head.  From the smell of it I knew this was going to be a long pint to finish.  Smells like a lemonade concentrate can, the type that requires you to add 4 more cans of water before you get a drinkable lemonade.  Very yeasty.  Very sour and acidic.  Too much lemon.  All that without a refreshing tartness.  Draught in some England pub.  Toward the end of my stay in London I was getting bored by English beers and just wanted something else.  After that pint English Bitters didn’t seem so boring anymore.
Bought this in Strasbourg,France the was origenal blue bottles. A Belgian White style, fruity taste a nice aroma. From a big French brewery this is a good Whitebeer
Bottle. Unclear yellow body with white medium head. Banana, grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit flavor.

Medium creamy white head. Hazy greenish yellow body with some ongoing carbonation. Wheaty yeasty aroma with faintly acidic citric notes. Deep, tart, acidic lemon taste with a slightly mealy mouthfeel. Tart, lemony aftertaste. A nice wit; very refreshing. (0.5l on tap.)

cloudy lactic/yellow colour under a creamy white head; citrusy nose with notes of coriander and orange peel; rather sweet and with a moderate malt body, the finish is bland with light citrusy notes and an unexpected yeasty touch - incoherent
Hazy yellow colour with a snowwhite foamy head. Wheaty, fruity sweet aroma with notes of yeast and spices. Sweet fruity flavor with a light citric note. Light dry and acidic finish.

Excellent brew for the French. I tried regular Kro because it was the local brew, that stuff sucks though, too watery. This has great balanced fruity taste, with a normal beer abv, unlike the regualr crap in a green bottle. Can’t get it in the us though, had it in France.

Bottle. Hazy yellow color with small but creamy head. Sweet lemonade-like aroma of apricot and citrus fruits. Refreshing flavor with some sweetness, mild acidity and tropical fruits (apricot, grapefruit, pineapple). Close to lemonade.
Murky straw body, poor head, passionfruit aroma and apricots in the taste. Simple yet drinkable.
Draught. Hazy yellow colour with a small white head. Fruity aroma with lots of citrus. Sweet malty flavor with lots of citrus and coriander. Sweet malty citrus in the aftertaste.
Bottled. Hazy yellow in colou r with a small white head. The aroma is wheaty with a fruity citric scent. It’s light bodied, the flavour is yeaste and wheaty. There is a sweetness in the aftertaste.

(Bottled) Very hazy yellow with a small, white head. Sweet lemon-candy aroma with raisins, much like Finnish mead. Lemony-perfumy-soapy, coriander-spicy flavor with a sourish finish. No hops found here. Quite light-bodied, reasonably refreshing palate with lemonadey carbonation. On the borderline of beer, Two Dogs and alcopops, it manages to be a somewhat drinkable summer brew. Still a bit too artificial to be really enjoyable.
Geat sweet smell and fruity taste. I don’t think more than a few pints of this smooth beer could be had due to the actual sweetness. After two pints of this I usually change to a more bitter beer.

bought in switzerland in a 0.33 liter-bottle.by the way,my botttle is made from blue glass,but it is the same beer
small,white head
nice yellow-hazy color
smells spicy,yeasty,the coriander is very distinctible,but orange too,even if a bit hidden behind,smells a bit sweetish,but some citrus is there too,a bit viny,smells a bit like some perfume
middle carbonated 
in taste,the coriander is rather strong,but orange taste is there too,and a bit of citrus(a bit sweet-sourish),some perfume-like flavour
aftertaste coriander,orange and even some banana,something bittersweet(a bit of hops),and a bit of perfume-like fruit at the end)
not bad,but could have a little bit less coriander-taste,and smell a bit less sweetish,but interesting.remembers me some stronger christmas-beers(in france.and specially in alsace,there is a tradition of brewing christmasbeers with spices and orange added)
a beer between witbier and some christmasbeers,more refreshing than a christmasbeer,but altough a little bit unusual for me in summer.
500ml bottle. floral aroma, fruity taste: citrus, orange, hint of strawberry, far far too sweet and leaves a similar aftertaste. almost a pretentious alcopop. Price counts against it aswell.
Bottle. White short head. Unclear yellow/green body. Banana grapefruit aroma. Grapefruit flavor.

(on bottle)Frensh sodapop here. Aroma of Kondivand and elderflowerlemonade. Pale, mily yellow, with a huge white head. Very whiped cream-like in the mouthfeel. Slightly tart, yet cloying sweet finish.
Orange, lemon and mild spices in aroma. Thin to medium bodied. Orange, citrus, mild spices in flavor, aftertaste is mildly dry and spicy with lemon tones.

Cask, at Catherines Wheel.
Light yellow with a white creamy head. Aroma moderate malty (sour), light hoppy. Flavor light sweet and sour. Light body, watery, soft carbonated. Not a success!

Half Pint, Draught. Cool, fruity citrus aromas, more distinct than other commercial witbier. The taste, however, was highly dissapointing - reminded me of drinking sherbert lemonade or smirnoff ice. It was also extremely sweet. It has the look of a faint white beer (like Hoegaarden) but less head. Looks can be deceptive...

Bottled (BB 09/2006)

Just released in Finland - the first Kronenbourg here with a big importer and some advertising. Hazy pale yellow, small white head. Aroma has wheat, yeast and leather. Semi-carbonated, sourish witbier. A bit fruity, not very spicey (more like sourish). Sourness and orange peel in the aftertaste. This is quite interesting mix of lambic and orangy witbier but a bit empty.

Bottled. Yellow hazy colour, mediumsized white head. Strong orange aroma, with wheaty and citric hints. The flavour is strong orange along with other fruits and a bit wheat. Easy to drink, and refreshing. So Kronenbourg is trying to break the witbier style by doing a lemonadeish version (the orange added...). Well, I still quite liked it, but be warned...

Draught at Ferdinand in Gothenburg Sweden, on the guest tap so not sure for how long they’ll have it.Pale shady light yellow color with a white creamy head. Very strong scent that feels mostly sour. A bit watery but fresh taste. Pretty much no bitterness. Sour aftertaste.
On tap at the beer palace,Oslo. Yellow colour with white head. Citrus and banana aroma.Pleasent round flavour of citrus and apricot. Good finish.

1. On Tap at the Penny Black, Northwich (JDW) 28/06/2005
Straw golden coloured with a cloudy appearance. Fruity lemon aroma and flavour. Crisp slightly dry lasting finish.
2. On Tap at the Penny Black, Northwich 29/06/2005
Golden coloured with a cloudy appearance. Fruity lemon aroma and flavour. Crisp smooth slightly creamy finish.
3. On Tap at the Penny Black, Northwich 05/07/2005
Golden coloured with a cloudy appearance. Fruity lemon aroma and flavour. Crisp slightly dry creamy malt finish.
4. On Tap at the Penny Black, Northwich 15/07/2005
Golden coloured with a hazy appearance. Fruity lemon aroma and flavour. Some dryness in a slightly creamy finish.

I must admit I love this fruity and fresh whitebeer.  There´s only one mistake about this beer: It´s only 30 cl!! Must be served cold, at 4-6 degrees celsius. According to the brewery. Found this beer also in Horsens, at Café Noisette. Brewed by adding some lemon grape.  Colour and looks like a Hoegarden. More fruity and sweet. Taste of summer and girls in bikini.
On tap at Beer Palace, Oslo. Yellow beer with a small white head. Aromas of apple, citrus and yeast. Fruity flavor with apple, yeast and cellar notes. Medium body. (060225)

Bottled(500ml). -sweet and fruity flavor, aroma of lemon and apricot with slight coriander notes,  had this one with few friends and they were enchanted with this beer, but for me this was just another average brew, tastes like pancakes with apricot jam

Fresh, with a taste of lemon. No great experience but a good party beer, for those who don’t appreciate beer.
300 ml white bottle, clearly a marketing design.

300 ml white painted bottle, at Cardinal, Stavanger. Colour is typical wit: Hazy, very pale straw coloured. Moderate head. Strong aroma of coriander, yeast and some citrus, and if I’m unkind:  even some notes of perfumed shampoo and hints of vomit. Flavour is VERY citrussy / LEMONY, notes of coriander too. A bit too lemony for me, but definitely a refreshing beer for hot summer days. Just a faint bitterness in the aftertaste. The chicks might like it!
Liquid chewing-gum. A rather creamy brew with hints of lemon-shells. Sweet artificial and perfumed aroma. Beer grows in the mouth to a thick, sticky substance. Disgusting!
Bottle.cloudy yellow colour with a small white head. Sweet fruity, citrus, coriander aroma and  taste. Medium body and a sweet finish.
Bottle.  Cloudy pale beer with a strong white head.  Nice fruity almost strawberry aroma with a lightly refreshing citric flavour.  Overall a pretty good effort.

(Bottle 50 cl) Hazy pale golden with a pretty much absent head. Aroma of coriander and citrus. Flavour though is surprisingly one of peach although not sweet. Must be an ester from the yeast. Only slightly tart. A pleasant surprise. 301005

Bottled.
Hazy pale yellow coloured with a small white head.
Aroma of orange peel and spices.
Sweet flavour of orange peel and spices.

Bottle from Asda. Pale. Aroma is fruity, sweet and a touch soapy. Flavour is sweet and fruity with some background wheat character, a touch of spice and a slight sournesss. I higly suspect this has fruit juice added so I would call it a fruit beer. Not a very good one at that either.
